Steam (ST): "Yes, I will never forget that. It happened in April of 1987. I received a certain strange request from a friend.
Umineko Project (UP): "Yes, I will never forget it. It happened in April of 1987. I received a certain strange request from a friend."
PC Japanese (JP): 「えぇ、あれは忘れもしない。１９８７年４月のことです。私は友人から、ある奇妙な依頼を受けました。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「えぇ、あれは忘れもしない。１９８７年４月のことです。私は友人から、ある奇妙な依頼を受けました」
Russian (RU): "Да, я никогда в жизни этого не забуду. Это произошло в апреле 1987 года. Друг попросил меня о чём‐то определённо странном."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim, eu nunca esqueceria aquilo. Aconteceu em abril de 1987. Eu recebi um certo pedido estranho de um amigo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「當然，這可忘不了。那是 1987 年 4 月的事兒。我從朋友那接到了一個奇妙的委託。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「当然，这可忘不了。那是 1987 年 4 月的事儿。我从朋友那接到了一个奇妙的委托。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sì, non lo scorderò mai. È accaduto nell'aprile del 1987. Ho ricevuto una richiesta alquanto strana da un amico.

Steam (ST): ...There was a large collection of books, the former possessions of a very rich man, that were being sold at auction, and it was thought that some of them might've been extremely valuable to the study of archeology and folklore, as well as in an occult sense, so this friend wanted to witness their worth confidentially."
Umineko Project (UP): "......A large collection of books, the former possessions of a very rich man, were being sold at auction, and it was thought that some of them might have been extremely valuable from an archaeological and folkloristic perspective, as well as in an occult sense, so this friend wanted me to take a private look at their value."
PC Japanese (JP): ……とある大富豪の遺品である蔵書が大量に競売に掛けられていて、その一部に、民俗学的にも考古学的にも、あるいはオカルト的な意味でも極めて価値の高いものが含まれていると思われる、その価値を内密に見て欲しいというのです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……とある大富豪の遺品である蔵書が大量に競売に掛けられていて、その一部に、民俗学的にも考古学的にも、あるいはオカルト的な意味でも極めて価値の高いものが含まれていると思われる、その価値を内密に見て欲しいというのです」
Russian (RU): "......Некоему богачу когда‐то принадлежала огромная коллекция книг, которые теперь продавались с аукциона, и предполагалось, что некоторые из них имели огромную ценность как предметы для археологических и фольклорных исследований, включая также оккультные, поэтому мой друг хотел конфиденциально убедиться в их ценности."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Uma vasta coleção de livros, na qual pertenciam anteriormente a um homem muito rico, foi vendida em um leilão, e parece que alguns deles eram extremamente valiosos, de uma perspectiva arqueológica e folclórica, bem como em um sentido oculto, por isso, esse amigo queria que eu os olhasse, em particular, o valor deles."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……說是某大富豪遺產的藏書被大批投入拍賣，其中一部分貌似，在民俗學也好、在考古學也罷，又或許在神秘學的意義上亦是，具有著極高的價值，希望我能對外保密地去看看，估估價。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……说是某大富豪遗产的藏书被大批投入拍卖，其中一部分貌似，在民俗学也好、在考古学也罢，又或许在神秘学的意义上亦是，具有着极高的价值，希望我能对外保密地去看看，估估价。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... C'era una vasta collezione di libri, che appartenevano a un uomo molto ricco e che sono stati venduti all'asta, e si pensava che qualcuno di quelli fosse molto prezioso per gli studi di archeologia e del folklore, così come per l'occulto, così questo amico voleva controllare se fossero meritevoli d'attenzione."
Italian (Majotachi no Sub) (New) (IT): "......A large collection of books, the former possessions of a very rich man, were being sold at auction, and it was thought that some of them might have been extremely valuable from an archeological and folkloristic perspective, as well as in an occult sense, so this friend wanted me to take a private look at their value."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "......That was '87. Half a year after the crime on Rokkenjima."
Umineko Project (UP): "..................'87. Half a year after the crime on Rokkenjima."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………………８７年。六軒島での事件の半年後。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………………８７年。六軒島での事件の半年後」
Russian (RU): "............87 год. Полгода спустя после преступления на Роккенджиме."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "..................1987? Meio ano após o incidente em Rokkenjima?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………………87 年。是六軒島事件的半年後麼？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………………87 年。是六轩岛事件的半年后么？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "...'87. Metà anno dopo l'incidente di Rokkenjima."

Steam (ST): "Correct. It was explained that those books had escaped the disaster at Rokkenjima. The owner of the island, Ms. Ushiromiya Eva, had put them up for auction."
Umineko Project (UP): "Correct. Those books were explained to have escaped the disaster on Rokkenjima. I was told that the owner of the island, {nobr:Mrs. Ushiromiya} Eva, had put them up for auction."
PC Japanese (JP): 「左様です。それらの蔵書は、六軒島での難を逃れたものと説明されていました。それを、島の所有者である右代宮絵羽氏が競売に出したというのです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「左様です。それらの蔵書は、六軒島での難を逃れたものと説明されていました。それを、島の所有者である右代宮絵羽氏が競売に出したというのです」
Russian (RU): "Совершенно верно. По его словам, эти книги избежали катастрофы на Роккенджиме. Владелица острова, Уширомия Ева, отправила их на аукцион."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Correto. Foi dito que aqueles livros escaparam do desastre de Rokkenjima.{n}A dona daquela ilha, {nobr:Sra. Ushiromiya} Eva, os colocou em leilão."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是的。據解釋，這批藏書乃是逃過六軒島一劫之物。是島的所有者，右代宮繪羽氏拿出來拍賣的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是的。据解释，这批藏书乃是逃过六轩岛一劫之物。是岛的所有者，右代宫绘羽氏拿出来拍卖的。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Corretto. Avevano spiegato che quei libri erano sfuggiti al disastro su Rokkenjima. La proprietaria dell'isola, Ms. Ushiromiya Eva, li aveva messi all'asta."

Steam (ST): This was apparently a high-class restaurant. A middle-aged man was sitting across from Ange in a secluded and quiet seat.
Umineko Project (UP): They appeared to be at a high‐class restaurant. Ange and a middle‐aged man were sitting across from one another in a pair of secluded and quiet seats.
PC Japanese (JP): そこは高級なレストランのようだった。奥まって離れた静かな席に、初老の男と縁寿は向かい合って座っていた。
Russian (RU): Разговор происходил в ресторане очевидно высшего класса. Напротив Энджи, в укромном и не вызывающем какого‐либо шума сидении, сидел мужчина средних лет.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aparentemente isto ocorreu em um restaurante de alta classe. Ange e um homem de meia idade estavam de frente um para o outro em assentos mais reservados.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 此處看似是一個高級西餐廳。在餐廳深處僻靜的位子上，面對面地坐著緣壽與一位剛步入老年的男子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 此处看似是一个高级西餐厅。在餐厅深处僻静的位子上，面对面地坐着缘寿与一位刚步入老年的男子。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Questo era all'apparenza un ristorante di alta classe. In un posto appartato e tranquillo, un uomo di mezz'età sedeva di fronte ad Ange.

Steam (ST): Amakusa could be seen by the entrance. He was probably keeping a lookout for pursuers from the Sumadera family.
Umineko Project (UP): Amakusa could be seen by the restaurant's entrance.{n}He was probably keeping a lookout for pursuers from the Sumadera family.
PC Japanese (JP): 天草の姿はレストランの入り口にある。須磨寺家の追っ手が来ないか見張っているのだろう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 天草の姿はレストランの入り口にある。{n}須磨寺家の追っ手が来ないか見張っているのだろう。
Russian (RU): У входа в ресторан виднелся Амакуса.{n}Он, похоже, стоял на стрёме на случай, если объявится кто‐нибудь из преследователей из семьи Сумадера.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Amakusa podia ser visto na entrada do restaurante.{n}Ele provavelmente estava de guarda para o caso de perseguidores da família Sumadera aparecerem.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 天草的身影則是在西餐廳的入口處。{n}他是在把風，提防須磨寺家的追兵吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 天草的身影则是在西餐厅的入口处。{n}他是在把风，提防须磨寺家的追兵吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Si poteva scorgere Amakusa all'entrata del ristorante. Probabilmente stava in guardia contro gli inseguitori della famiglia Sumadera.

Steam (ST): The scholarly man across from Ange spoke politely, but with enthusiasm.
Umineko Project (UP): The scholarly seeming man across from Ange spoke politely, but with enthusiasm.
PC Japanese (JP): 縁寿の向かいの、学識ありそうな男は、丁寧な口調ながら熱っぽく語っていた。
Russian (RU): Человек учёного вида напротив Энджи говорил вежливо, но с энтузиазмом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O homem de aparência erudita em frente à Ange falou de forma polida, mas com entusiasmo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 坐在緣壽對面的，看起來頗具學識的男子，以禮貌的語調起勁地講述著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 坐在缘寿对面的，看起来颇具学识的男子，以礼貌的语调起劲地讲述着。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Lo studioso di fronte ad Ange parlava educatamente, ma con entusiasmo.

Steam (ST): He didn't lay a finger on the food in front of him, so you could tell how excited he was as he spoke fervently.
Umineko Project (UP): He hadn't so much as touched the food in front of him, which communicated effectively the passion with which he was speaking.
PC Japanese (JP): 手元の料理には一切手をつけておらず、どれほどの熱弁を奮っているか想像できる。
Russian (RU): Он не притронулся к еде перед ним, что говорило о том, насколько он был взволнован, пока с жаром вёл повествование.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela não havia tocado muito na comida à sua frente, o que demonstrava como ele estava empolgado em falar sobre aquilo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 放在他面前的料理一點都沒有被動過，可見他是在多麼投入地熱情講解。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 放在他面前的料理一点都没有被动过，可见他是在多么投入地热情讲解。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non aveva toccato il cibo che aveva davanti nemmeno con un dito, quindi si poteva capire quanto fosse eccitato mentre parlava con fervore.

Steam (ST): He was a professor at a certain college, and particularly well-known as an authority on Western folklore.
Umineko Project (UP): He was a professor at a certain university, known in particular as an authority on Western folklore.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼は某大学の教授で、特に西洋の民俗学の権威として知られていた。
Russian (RU): Он являлся профессором в каком‐то колледже и был в особенности хорошо известен как знаток западного фольклора.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele era professor de uma certa universidade, muito conhecido por ser uma autoridade do folclore no ocidente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他是某大學的教授，特別在西洋民俗學上是以權威而聞名。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他是某大学的教授，特别在西洋民俗学上是以权威而闻名。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era un professore di qualche college, ed era particolarmente conosciuto come un esperto del folklore occidentale.

Steam (ST): However, among his life works, that was only a convenient exterior.
Umineko Project (UP): However, among his life works, that was only the one with the most acceptable public face.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、それは彼のライフワークの中で、もっとも外面の良いものに過ぎない。
Russian (RU): Однако среди работ его жизни данная специализация являлась лишь удобной ширмой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entretanto, entre os trabalhos de sua vida, era apenas um que era mais aceito como um fato público.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，這只不過是他的研究中，最表面化、最放得上台面的學科。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，这只不过是他的研究中，最表面化、最放得上台面的学科。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, nella sua vita lavorativa, quella era solo una conveniente facciata.

Steam (ST): His true life work was... the study of occultism, Western magic, alchemy, and everything else to do with the occult, as well as demonology.
Umineko Project (UP): His true life work...was the study of Western occultism, Western magic, alchemy, and all else falling under the umbrella of "the occult", as well as demonology.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼の本当のライフワークは、神秘学、西洋魔法、錬金術、それら全てを内包するオカルト、そして悪魔学。
Russian (RU): Истинная же работа его жизни... представляла собой изучение оккультизма, магии запада, алхимии, а также всего остального, что связано с оккультизмом, включая демонологию.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O verdadeiro trabalho de sua vida...era um estudo do ocultismo ocidental, magia ocidental, alquimia e tudo mais que se enquadrava na categoria de "oculto", bem como demonologia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他真正當做畢生事業在研究的，是將神秘學、西洋魔法、鍊金術等全部包括在內的神秘事物，以及惡魔學。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他真正当做毕生事业在研究的，是将神秘学、西洋魔法、炼金术等全部包括在内的神秘事物，以及恶魔学。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La sua vera vita lavorativa era... lo studio dell'occultismo, magia occidentale, alchimia, e qualsiasi altra cosa avesse a che fare con l'occulto, così come la demonologia.

Steam (ST): In short, he was the person in the best position to understand the details of Kinzo's research...
Umineko Project (UP): In short, he was one of the people best positioned to understand the details of Kinzo's research...
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、金蔵の研究内容をもっとも理解できる立場にある人間のひとりであった…。
Russian (RU): Короче говоря, он был человеком, способным лучше всего понять детали и подробности исследования Кинзо...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Resumindo, ele era uma das pessoas mais capacitadas para entender em detalhes as pesquisas de Kinzo...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 也就是說，他是一位處於最能理解金藏研究內容的立場上的人…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 也就是说，他是一位处于最能理解金藏研究内容的立场上的人…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In poche parole, era la persona più adatta a capire i dettagli della ricerca di Kinzo...

Speaker: Professor Ootsuki
Steam (ST): "First, what I learned by appraising those books was that Ms. Ushiromiya Eva had absolutely no education in the study of folklore... and that the original owner of the books, Ushiromiya Kinzo, was certainly one of the top five authorities on demonology in Japan."
Umineko Project (UP): "First, what I learned by appraising the books was that {nobr:Mrs. Ushiromiya} Eva had absolutely no education in folkloristics, and that the original owner of the books, {nobr:Mr. Ushiromiya} Kinzo, was without doubt one of the top five authorities on demonology in Japan."
PC Japanese (JP): 「まず、蔵書を鑑定してわかったことは、右代宮絵羽氏には民俗学的な教養はまったくなく、そしてその蔵書の本来の持ち主である右代宮金蔵氏は、日本で五指に入る悪魔学の権威であったことは、間違いないということです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「まず、蔵書を鑑定してわかったことは、右代宮絵羽氏には民俗学的な教養はまったくなく、そしてその蔵書の本来の持ち主である右代宮金蔵氏は、日本で五指に入る悪魔学の権威であったことは、間違いないということです」
Russian (RU): "Первой подробностью, что я узнал при оценке книг, являлось абсолютное отсутствие у Уширомия Евы образования в сфере изучения фольклора, а также то, что изначальный владелец книг, Уширомия Кинзо, являлся одним из пяти лучших знатоков по демонологии в Японии."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Primeiro, o que eu aprendi avaliando os livros é que a {nobr:Sra. Ushiromiya} Eva não possuía qualquer conhecimento sobre folclore, e o dono original dos livros, {nobr:Sr. Ushiromiya} Kinzo, era, sem dúvida, uma das cinco principais autoridades em demonologia do Japão."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「首先，我通過鑑定藏書所明白的，是右代宮繪羽氏全無民俗學上的修養，以及這批藏書原本的主人右代宮金藏氏，無疑是在日本排得進前五的惡魔學權威。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「首先，我通过鉴定藏书所明白的，是右代宫绘羽氏全无民俗学上的修养，以及这批藏书原本的主人右代宫金藏氏，无疑是在日本排得进前五的恶魔学权威。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Innanzitutto, ciò che ho appreso esaminando i libri è che Ms. Ushiromiya Eva non aveva assolutamente alcuna educazione nello studio del folklore, e che l'originale proprietario dei libri, Ushiromiya Kinzo, era senza dubbio uno dei cinque massimi esperti di demonologia in Giappone."

Steam (ST): April, 1987.
Umineko Project (UP): April, 1987.
Russian (RU): Апрель 1987 года.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Abril, 1987.
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Aprile, 1987.

Steam (ST): A major city antique shop obtained a large quantity of ancient documents that were thought to have a high historical value.
Umineko Project (UP): A major city antique shop came into possession of a large quantity of ancient texts thought to have a high historical value.
PC Japanese (JP): 都内の大手古物商が、歴史的価値が高いと思われる大量の古文書を入手する。
Russian (RU): Городской антикварный магазин приобрёл огромное количество старинных документов, которые, как считалось, имеют большую историческую ценность.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Um grande antiquário da cidade ficou de posse de uma vasta quantidade de textos antigos que teriam um alto valor histórico.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 東京都的某個大古董商拿到了一大批估計具有很高歷史價值的古書。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 东京都的某个大古董商拿到了一大批估计具有很高历史价值的古书。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Un negozio di antichità molto grande in città ha reperito una gran quantità di antichi documenti che si pensava avessero un gran valore storico.

Steam (ST): They were entrusted with them by Ushiromiya Eva, who wanted them to be sold at auction.
Umineko Project (UP): The texts had been entrusted to them by Ushiromiya Eva, who had requested for them to be put up for auction on her behalf.
PC Japanese (JP): これは、右代宮絵羽が競売に掛けるよう依頼して預けたものであった。
Russian (RU): Они попали в него после того, как Уширомия Ева продала их на аукционе.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os textos foram confiados a ela por Ushiromiya Eva, que os requisitou para serem colocados a leilão em seu nome.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這批書是右代宮繪羽委託其拍賣，寄放在古董商處的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这批书是右代宫绘羽委托其拍卖，寄放在古董商处的。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ne erano entrati in possesso dopo che Ushiromiya Eva li aveva venduti all'asta.

Steam (ST): At the time, it was thought that Eva would succeed the Ushiromiya family and have all the wealth to herself, as the only survivor.
Umineko Project (UP): At the time, everyone thought that Eva had succeeded the Ushiromiya family and obtained all the wealth for herself as the only survivor.
PC Japanese (JP): 当時、絵羽は唯一の生き残りとして右代宮家の家督を継承し、全ての財産を独占したかに思われていた。
Russian (RU): Тогда считалось, что Ева самолично унаследует всё богатство семьи Уширомия как единственный выживший.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Naquela época, todos pensaram que Eva havia sucedido a família Ushiromiya e obtido toda a riqueza para si, como única sobrevivente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 當時，輿論認為，繪羽作為唯一的生還者繼承了右代宮家的家督，獨吞了所有的財產。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 当时，舆论认为，绘羽作为唯一的生还者继承了右代宫家的家督，独吞了所有的财产。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): A quel tempo, si pensava che Eva sarebbe stata l'erede della famiglia Ushiromiya e che avrebbe avuto tutti i beni per sé come unica sopravvissuta.

Steam (ST): However, at that point, not even half a year had passed since the accident, and the others had not been missing long enough to be presumed dead, even under extraordinary circumstances.
Umineko Project (UP): However, at that point, barely half a year had passed since the accident, which was not enough for the rest of the family to be legally declared dead in absentia, even given the extraordinary circumstances.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、当時は事故から半年しか経ておらず、危難失踪が成立していなかった。
Russian (RU): Однако тогда же с момента трагедии не прошло и полгода, и несмотря на окружающие дело необычные обстоятельства, не было установлено, что другие отсутствовали достаточно долго, чтобы признать их мёртвыми.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entretanto, naquele momento, pouco mais de meio ano havia se passado desde o incidente, o que não era o suficiente para que a ausência do resto da família fosse legalmente declarada como morta, mesmo dadas as circunstâncias extraordinárias.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，當時距事故發生才只過了半年，遇難失踪尚未成立。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，当时距事故发生才只过了半年，遇难失踪尚未成立。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, a quel punto, nemmeno metà anno era passato dall'incidente, e nonostante le circostanze straordinarie, non era stato stabilito che gli altri fossero scomparsi così a lungo da essere ritenuti morti.

Steam (ST): Because of that, Eva had supposedly been in a very tight spot financially, unable even to collect on her family's life insurance.
Umineko Project (UP): Because of that, Eva was thought to have been in a very tight spot financially, unable even to collect from her family's life insurance.
PC Japanese (JP): その為、絵羽は家族の生命保険さえ降りず、経済的にかなり困窮していたと思われる。
Russian (RU): По этой причине считалось, что Ева находилась в трудном финансовом положении, не способная даже получить деньги со страховки жизней её родственников.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por causa disso, se pensou que Eva estava em uma situação financeira muito apertada, incapaz até de coletar o seguro de vida de sua família.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因此，繪羽可能是連家人的死亡保險賠償金都拿不到，經濟上非常窮困。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因此，绘羽可能是连家人的死亡保险赔偿金都拿不到，经济上非常穷困。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): A causa di ciò, si pensava che Eva fosse in ristrettezze economiche, essendo incapace di percepire l'assicurazione sulla vita della sua famiglia.

Steam (ST): It seems she tried to sell everything of value, and even the books kept in the place where she'd escaped harm in, Kuwadorian, were used for this purpose.
Umineko Project (UP): It seems that she tried to sell everything of value, and even the books kept in Kuwadorian, her location when she escaped harm, became a target of this.
PC Japanese (JP): 絵羽は金目のものは何でも売り払おうとしたらしく、彼女が難を逃れた時に所在していた九羽鳥庵に収められていた蔵書も、この対象となったのだ。
Russian (RU): Похоже, она пыталась продать всё ценное, и даже книги из того места, где она спаслась, Кувадориана, не избежали этой участи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Parece que ela tentou vender tudo o que tinha de valor, até mesmo os livros que estavam em Kuwadorian, local para o qual ela escapou dos danos se tornou alvo disto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那時的繪羽貌似想把值錢的東西都賣掉，收藏在她逃過一劫時身處的九羽鳥庵中的藏書也成了其中之一。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那时的绘羽貌似想把值钱的东西都卖掉，收藏在她逃过一劫时身处的九羽鸟庵中的藏书也成了其中之一。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Sembra che abbia cercato di vendere qualsiasi cosa avesse valore, e anche i libri custoditi nel luogo in cui era scappata, Kuwadorian, diventarono un bersaglio di ciò.

Steam (ST): These old books, which would eventually be called "the Ushiromiya Library", were later gathered from antique shops by authorities in the field so that they could be appraised, ...and those authorities were astounded.
Umineko Project (UP): And when the authorities in the field gathered at the request of the antique shop to appraise these documents—which were later called "the Ushiromiya Library"—they were given the shock of their lives.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、後に「右代宮蔵書」と呼ばれるそれら古文書は、古物商によって鑑定のために集められた権威たちの度肝を抜いた。
Russian (RU): А потом эти самые книги, названные "Библиотекой семьи Уширомия", оказались собраны для оценки из антикварных магазинов авторитетами в своих областях... И эти самые авторитеты были поражены.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E quando as autoridades no campo se juntaram devido ao pedido da loja de antiquário para avaliar os documentos — na qual posteriormente foram chamados de "Biblioteca Ushiromiya" — eles foram surpreendidos com algo que nunca imaginariam.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後，這批在之後被人稱為「右代宮藏書」的古書，將古董商為了鑑定而請來的權威們嚇破了膽。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后，这批在之后被人称为「右代宫藏书」的古书，将古董商为了鉴定而请来的权威们吓破了胆。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): E questi vecchi libri, che successivamente furono chiamati ‘la Biblioteca Ushiromiya’, furono in seguito raccolte dagli esperti del campo dai negozi di antichità così da poter essere valutati... e gli esperti rimasero strabiliati.

Speaker: Professor Ootsuki
Steam (ST): "At least speaking from the perspective of occultism, the impact of that discovery on the world was comparable to the discovery of the Dead Sea scrolls."
Umineko Project (UP): "At least speaking from the perspective of occultism, the shock waves that discovery sent throughout the world were comparable to the discovery of the Dead Sea Scrolls."
PC Japanese (JP): 「少なくとも神秘学の見地から言えば、その発見が世界に与えた衝撃は死海文書発見にも匹敵するものでした。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「少なくとも神秘学の見地から言えば、その発見が世界に与えた衝撃は死海文書発見にも匹敵するものでした」
Russian (RU): "По крайней мере, с оккультной точки зрения, эффект от того открытия был равносилен открытию Свитков Мёртвого моря."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ao menos falando da perspectiva do ocultismo, as ondas de choque que aquela descoberta enviou através do mundo foram comparadas a descoberta dos Manuscritos do Mar Morto."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「至少從神秘學的觀點來講，這次發現，甚至與帶給世界衝擊的{c:86EF9C:死海文書}的發現匹敵。{c:86EF9C:（詳見魔導書同名條目）}」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「至少从神秘学的观点来讲，这次发现，甚至与带给世界冲击的{c:86EF9C:死海文书}的发现匹敌。{c:86EF9C:（详见魔导书同名条目）}」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Almeno parlando dal punto di vista dell'occulto, l'impatto di quella scoperta sul mondo era paragonabile a quella della scoperta dei rotoli del Mar Morto.

Speaker: Professor Ootsuki
Steam (ST): "This is because...contained within "the Ushiromiya Library" were many extremely vital documents that had never been found, though their existence had been known of for more than a millenium."
Umineko Project (UP): "The reason for this is that the "Ushiromiya Library" even included some extremely important documents...which had been known to exist for more than a thousand years, but had never before been found."
PC Japanese (JP): 『右代宮蔵書』には、なんと千年以上にも亘る間、その存在だけが知られているにもかかわらず、発見されていなかった数々の極めて重要な文献さえ含まれていたからです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「『右代宮蔵書』には、なんと千年以上にも亘る間、その存在だけが知られているにもかかわらず、発見されていなかった数々の極めて重要な文献さえ含まれていたからです」
Russian (RU): "Так было потому, что 'Библиотека семьи Уширомия' содержала множество различных и чрезвычайно важных документов, о существовании которых было известно более тысячи лет, однако прежде они так и не были найдены."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "O motivo para isso é que a "Biblioteca Ushiromiya" incluía até mesmo alguns documentos extremamente importantes...os quais já se tinha conhecimento da existência há mais de mil anos, mas nunca haviam sido encontrados."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「這是因為，在『右代宮藏書』中，居然有著在橫跨上千年的歲月裡，只知其存在，而一直都未被發現的許許多多極其重要的文獻。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「这是因为，在『右代宫藏书』中，居然有着在横跨上千年的岁月里，只知其存在，而一直都未被发现的许许多多极其重要的文献。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Questo perché, contenuti nella ‘Biblioteca Ushiromiya’, vi erano molti documenti estremamente importanti che, nonostante la loro esistenza fosse stata nota per più di mille anni, non furono mai trovati."

Steam (ST): The many dreams of the occult, such as those represented by alchemy, always stirred an intense fascination in dilettantes.
Umineko Project (UP): The so‐called "romantic" side of the occult, epitomized for example by alchemy, never ceases to stir an intense fascination in dilettantes.
PC Japanese (JP): 錬金術に代表されるような、いわゆる夢のあるオカルトは、常に好事家を魅了して止まない。
Russian (RU): Множество оккультных мечтаний, вроде представленных в алхимии, всегда разжигали страстное увлечение в любителях и дилетантах.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O tão chamado lado "romântico" do oculto epitomizado, por exemplo, pela alquimia, nunca deixou de instigar um fascínio extremo aos diletantes.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 以鍊金術為代表的富有夢幻色彩的神秘學，無時無刻不在魅惑著好事者們。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 以炼金术为代表的富有梦幻色彩的神秘学，无时无刻不在魅惑着好事者们。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): I molti sogni dell'occulto, come quelli rappresentati dall'alchimia, avevano sempre un grande fascino sui dilettanti.

Steam (ST): It is whispered that many "magic books" of great historical value, currently unknown to the public, might be in the secret possession of extremely wealthy lovers of the occult.
Umineko Project (UP): Even now, it is whispered that in various places around the world, a great number of "magic books" of historical value...might be in the secret possession of very wealthy lovers of the occult, unannounced to the public.
PC Japanese (JP): 未だに全世界には、未公表の歴史価値ある「魔法書」が大量に残されていて、オカルトを愛する大富豪たちが秘密に所持しているのではないかと囁かれているのである。
Russian (RU): Поэтому ходят слухи, что множество "магических книг", имеющих огромную историческую ценность и пока неизвестных широкой публике, может находиться в тайном владении богатых заядлых любителей оккультизма.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo agora, é sussurrado em vários cantos do mundo que um grande número de "livros mágicos" de valor histórico...poderiam estar sob posse de amantes muito ricos do ocultismo, sem o conhecimento do público.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 據傳，在這個世界上，可能還留有許許多多尚未公諸於眾的「魔法書」，被熱愛神秘學的大富豪們秘密收藏著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 据传，在这个世界上，可能还留有许许多多尚未公诸于众的「魔法书」，被热爱神秘学的大富豪们秘密收藏着。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Si mormora che molti ‘libri magici’ di grande valore storico, non ancora mostrati al pubblico, potrebbero essere dei beni segreti di amanti dell'occulto molto ricchi.

Steam (ST): Items such as Leonardo da Vinci's notebooks, which are particularly popular among dilettantes, are said to be prime examples of this.
Umineko Project (UP): The prime candidates for this are said to be items such as Leonardo da Vinci's notebooks, which are particularly popular among dilettantes.
PC Japanese (JP): 好事家の中でもとりわけ人気の高い、レオナルド・ダ・ヴィンチの手稿などがその最たるものと言われる。
Russian (RU): Поговаривали, что такие вещи, как записки Леонардо да Винчи, особенно популярные среди дилетантов, являлись ярким примером подобных книг.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os principais candidatos são ditos como os cadernos de Leonardo da Vinci, que são particularmente populares entre os diletantes.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在好事者中也擁有特別高的人氣的萊奧納多·達·芬奇的手稿，據說就是最典型的例子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在好事者中也拥有特别高的人气的莱奥纳多·达·芬奇的手稿，据说就是最典型的例子。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Si dice che oggetti come il taccuino di Leonardo da Vinci, che sono piuttosto popolari tra i dilettanti, ne fossero i primi esempi.

Steam (ST): It is said that approximately 5,000 pages of these notebooks currently exist, and that over 10,000 have been lost, but some researchers believe that a large part of this lost portion may be monopolized by certain enthusiasts and members of the extremely rich.
Umineko Project (UP): It is said that approximately five thousand pages of the notebooks currently exist, and over ten thousand have been lost, but some researchers believe that a large part of this lost portion may be being monopolized by certain dilettantes and millionaires.
PC Japanese (JP): 手稿は約五千枚が現存し、一万枚以上が紛失していると言われるが、この紛失分の数割が、特定の大富豪や好事家によって独占されている可能性があると一部の研究者は見ている。
Russian (RU): Также ходят слухи о существовании около 5000 страниц этих записок и о потере более 10000 других страниц, но некоторые исследователи полагают, что большая часть из потерянного может находиться в руках у определённых любителей и индивидуумов, принадлежащих к числу богатых людей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É dito que existem aproximadamente cinco mil páginas desses cadernos, e mais de dez mil foram perdidas, mas alguns pesquisadores acreditam que grande parte dessa porção perdida está sendo monopolizada por certos diletantes e milionários.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然據說手稿現存約五千張，遺失了上萬張，但一部分研究者認為，遺失部分中的大多數有可能是被某些特定的大富豪與好事者占為已有了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然据说手稿现存约五千张，遗失了上万张，但一部分研究者认为，遗失部分中的大多数有可能是被某些特定的大富豪与好事者占为已有了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Si dice che approssimativamente 5000 pagine del taccuino esistano ancora oggi, e che oltre 10,000 siano state perdute, ma alcuni ricercatori credono che una grossa parte di questa sezione perduta potrebbe essere monopolizzata da alcuni dilettanti e da alcune persone estremamente ricche.

Steam (ST): It is said that because of this, even now, dilettantes who can't help but seek these spare no expense to search around for quietly hoarded away and unannounced notebooks...
Umineko Project (UP): It is said that because of this, even now, dilettantes who can't help but seek these spare no expense to search around for quietly hoarded‐away and unannounced notebooks...
PC Japanese (JP): その為、今もなお、求めて止まない好事家が、死蔵されて眠っている未公開手稿を求め、金に糸目をつけずに探し回っているという…。
Russian (RU): Ещё говорят, что по этой причине даже сейчас любители, которые не в силах удержаться от поиска подобных документов, не жалеют средств в стремлении отыскать быстро припрятанные и не объявленные записки...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É dito que por causa disso, mesmo agora, diletantes não podem fazer nada além de buscar por cadernos guardados em sigilo e nunca anunciados, sem poupar despesas...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因此，即便是現在，也有著對其謀求不止的好事者，為了得到沉眠於封藏中的未公開手稿，而不惜重金地到處尋覓…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因此，即便是现在，也有着对其谋求不止的好事者，为了得到沉眠于封藏中的未公开手稿，而不惜重金地到处寻觅…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Si dice che a causa di tutto ciò, anche adesso, i dilettanti che non possono far altro che cercarli senza badare a spese per trovare taccuini tranquillamente dimenticati e non rivelati...

Steam (ST): There is probably no doubting that Ushiromiya Kinzo was himself one of those dilettantes.
Umineko Project (UP): There is probably no doubting that Ushiromiya Kinzo was himself one of those dilettantes.
PC Japanese (JP): 右代宮金蔵もまた、そんな類の好事家であったことは、疑いようもないだろう。
Russian (RU): Так что в принадлежности Уширомии Кинзо к числу таких любителей вряд ли можно было сомневаться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Provavelmente não restam dúvidas de que o próprio Ushiromiya Kinzo era um desses diletantes.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 右代宮金藏也屬於這類好事者，這是毋庸置疑的吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 右代宫金藏也属于这类好事者，这是毋庸置疑的吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non c'è alcun dubbio che Ushiromiya Kinzo fosse anch'esso uno di quei dilettanti.

Steam (ST): No one knows what Kinzo went through to obtain those, but there can be no mistake that he used his vast wealth freely, buying them off of other rich people with the same hobby as him.
Umineko Project (UP): It is unknown what Kinzo went through to obtain these, but undoubtedly he must have spent his vast wealth like water, to buy them off other rich people with the same hobby as him.
PC Japanese (JP): 金蔵がどのようにしてそれらを収集したかはわかっていないが、その莫大な富を湯水のように使い、同じ趣味を持つ同士の大富豪から買い取ったことは間違いあるまい。
Russian (RU): Всё ещё не известно, каким образом Кинзо удалось их заполучить, но нет ошибки в том, что он в полной мере воспользовался своим огромным богатством, скупая их у других богатых особ с такими же увлечениями, как и у него.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É desconhecido por quais meios Kinzo os obteve, mas sem dúvida ele gastou sua vasta riqueza como água, para comprá‐los de outras pessoas ricas com o mesmo hobby que ele.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然並不清楚金藏到底是怎麼把那些古書收集到一起的，但他肯定靠的是把巨額財富當水潑，從擁有著同樣興趣的大富豪那買下的手段吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然并不清楚金藏到底是怎么把那些古书收集到一起的，但他肯定靠的是把巨额财富当水泼，从拥有着同样兴趣的大富豪那买下的手段吧。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non si sa cosa fece Kinzo per procurarseli, ma non c'è alcun dubbio sull'abbondante uso che fece delle sue enormi ricchezze, comprandoli da altre persone ricche con il suo stesso hobby.

Steam (ST): Those books, which were so valuable that enthusiasts could never satisfy their desire to hoard them away, were discovered in large numbers at the end of the 20th century, and their release to the public had given the entire world a massive shock...
Umineko Project (UP): The discovery of that huge number of books at the end of the 20th century, books so valuable that dilettantes were filled with the desire to hoard them away, and their subsequent release to the public, gave the entire world a massive shock...
PC Japanese (JP): そんな、好事家たちが死蔵して独占欲を満たしたくなるほどに価値ある蔵書が２０世紀末に大量に発見、公開されたことは、全世界に大きな衝撃を与えた…。
Russian (RU): Эти книги, являющиеся настолько ценными, что дилетантам мало было просто скрывать их, оказались обнаруженными в конце XX века в огромном количестве, и их попадание в фокус широкой публики вызвало огромный шок во всём мире...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A descoberta desse grande número de livros ao final do século XX, tão valiosos que os diletantes foram tomados pelo desejo de acumulá‐los como tesouros, e a subsequente liberação deles ao público, deu ao mundo todo um grande choque...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這種價值高到會令好事者們為了滿足獨佔欲而封存箱底的藏書，在二十世紀末被大量地發現，得到公開，這可謂是給全世界帶來了巨大的衝擊…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这种价值高到会令好事者们为了满足独占欲而封存箱底的藏书，在二十世纪末被大量地发现，得到公开，这可谓是给全世界带来了巨大的冲击…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quei libri, che erano così preziosi che i dilettanti semplicemente non potevano soddisfare il loro desiderio di accaparrarseli, furono scoperti in largo numero alla fine del ventesimo secolo, e il loro rilascio al pubblico diede al mondo intero un enorme choc...

Speaker: Professor Ootsuki
Steam (ST): "Because of this case, the name <Rokkenjima> became known across the world. The world was also shocked to learn that, in all likelihood, a large number of even more valuable undiscovered books were lost during the accident on Rokkenjima."
Umineko Project (UP): "Due to this incident, the name Rokkenjima became known across the world. And at the same time, the world also received a shock at the very high probability that, due to the accident on Rokkenjima, a large amount of undiscovered books of even greater value had been lost."
PC Japanese (JP): 「この一件により、Rokkenjimaの名は全世界に知れ渡ることになります。そして同時に、六軒島の事故によって、未発見のさらに価値ある蔵書が大量に失われた可能性が高いことも、全世界に衝撃を与えました。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「この一件により、Rokkenjimaの名は全世界に知れ渡ることになります。そして同時に、六軒島の事故によって、未発見のさらに価値ある蔵書が大量に失われた可能性が高いことも、全世界に衝撃を与えました」

Speaker: Professor Ootsuki
Steam (ST): "It was once famous as a way of sending an SOS from a deserted island, but because of the influence of a certain prominent foreign detective novel, it has also become known as a method of confessing the truth after one's own death, like a time-delayed will. The case of the Rokkenjima message bottle was certainly one of the latter."
Umineko Project (UP): "It is famous as a way of sending an SOS from a deserted island, but because of the influence of famous foreign detective novels, it has also become known as a method of confessing the truth after one's own death, like a time‐delayed will. The Rokkenjima message bottle was certainly the latter."
PC Japanese (JP): 無人島からＳＯＳを発信する、というのが有名ですが、海外の有名推理小説の影響で、自らの死後に真実を告白するという、時間差的な遺書としても知られるようになりました。六軒島メッセージボトル事件は、まさにこの後者だったのです。」

Russian (RU): "Это известный способ отправки сигнала SOS с необитаемого острова, но из‐за влияния известных зарубежных детективных романов он в том числе стал также известен как способ признания правды после собственной смерти, вроде как запоздалое завещание. Случай с сообщением в бутылке с Роккенджимы, разумеется, относится к последнему."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É uma famosa forma de enviar um SOS de uma ilha deserta, mas devido a influência de famosos livros estrangeiros de detetives, também se tornou uma método conhecido de confessar a verdade após a própria morte, como uma vontade atrasada pelo tempo. A mensagem na garrafa de Rokkenjima certamente é a segunda opção."

Il caso con il messaggio in bottiglia di Rokkenjima appartiene senza dubbio alla seconda categoria."

Speaker: Professor Ootsuki
Steam (ST): "Correct. We learned that a young fisherman on Shikinejima picked up a wine bottle with a letter in it. This young fisherman kept it just out of curiosity. Then, because Rokkenjima had fallen under the world's attention due to the Ushiromiya Library, he announced his discovery."
Umineko Project (UP): "Correct. We learned that a young fisherman on Shikinejima had picked up a wine bottle with a letter in it. This young fisherman happened to keep it out of curiosity. It was only later, when Rokkenjima fell under the global spotlight due to the Ushiromiya Library, that he announced his discovery."

Steam (ST): "Correct. Due to that, interest in the Rokkenjima mystery increased even further. PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「左様です。このせいで、六軒島ミステリーはさらに面白みが増したのです。２つのボトルの中身は、どちらも事故前日から当日までを記した日記風の手記です。しかし、その内容は、ともに前日から当日を記した内容であり、にもかかわらず、内容はまったく異なったのです」
Russian (RU): "Верно. Это лишь подогрело интерес к тайне Роккенджимы. Внутри обеих бутылок содержались дневниковые тетради, по сути излагающие отчёт о событиях со дня до инцидента и в день инцидента. Однако хоть содержание обеих тетрадей и охватывало период в те два дня, содержание их совершенно отличалось."
