Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「天知道。………可以睡會兒嗎？我想那位話多的教授，一定會在講課時沉浸進自己的世界裡，搞得學生們接二連三地睡過去。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「天知道。………可以睡会儿吗？我想那位话多的教授，一定会在讲课时沉浸进自己的世界里，搞得学生们接二连三地睡过去。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Chi lo sa. ... Ti spiace se dormo? Scommetto che quel professore molto eloquente si perde in discorsi nel suo piccolo mondo e fa addormentare molti bambini."

Speaker: Amakusa Juuza
Steam (ST): "Please, go ahead, take a rest."
Umineko Project (UP): "Sure, sure, take a rest."
PC Japanese (JP): 「どうぞどうぞ、お休みを。」
Russian (RU): "Конечно, конечно, отдыхайте."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim, sim, pode descansar."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「請便請便，請休息吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「请便请便，请休息吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Prego, prego, fai un sonnellino."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "......Still, that went really well. That guy believed I was a Sumadera until the very end."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Still, that went really well. That guy believed I was Sumadera until the very end."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………しかし、うまく行くもんね。あいつ、私のこと、須磨寺だと最後まで信じてたわ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………しかし、うまく行くもんね。あいつ、私のこと、須磨寺だと最後まで信じてたわ」
Russian (RU): ".........Однако всё прошло очень даже гладко. Этот мужчина до самого конца считал меня Сумадерой."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Ainda assim, isso correu muito bem. Aquele cara acreditou que eu era uma Sumadera até o último instante."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………說來，還真挺順利的呢。那傢伙直到最後都以為我姓須磨寺。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………说来，还真挺顺利的呢。那家伙直到最后都以为我姓须磨寺。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Tuttavia, è andata davvero bene. Quel tizio ha creduto che fossi Sumadera fino alla fine."

Steam (ST): The Sumadera family had set up a web beforehand around any people Ange might try to contact.
Umineko Project (UP): The Sumadera family had cast out a net beforehand over any people Ange might try to contact.
PC Japanese (JP): 須磨寺家は、縁寿がコンタクトを取りそうな人物に予め網を張っていた。
Russian (RU): Семья Сумадера раскинула паутину, затронувшую всех людей, с которыми могла попытаться связаться Энджи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A família Sumadera já havia traçado uma rede de antemão sobre todas as pessoas que Ange poderia tentar entrar em contato.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 須磨寺家預先就對緣壽可能會去接觸的人物撒下了網。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 须磨寺家预先就对缘寿可能会去接触的人物撒下了网。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): La famiglia Sumadera aveva costruito in anticipo una rete attorno a qualsiasi persona Ange tentava di contattare.

Steam (ST): They had offered a reward to anyone who could take Ushiromiya Ange into custody if she appeared.
Umineko Project (UP): They had offered a reward for anyone who could detain Ushiromiya Ange if she appeared.
PC Japanese (JP): もしも右代宮縁寿が現れたら身柄を確保してほしい、謝礼を払うと。
Russian (RU): Они объявили о награде, которую может получить каждый, кому удастся взять под стражу Энджи, случись им пересечься с ней.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eles ofereceram uma recompensa por qualquer um que pudesse retardar Ushiromiya Ange se ela aparecesse.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 說了，如果右代宮緣壽出現，希望能協助捉拿，事後會支付謝禮。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 说了，如果右代宫缘寿出现，希望能协助捉拿，事后会支付谢礼。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Avevano offerto una ricompensa a chiunque fosse riuscito a prendere in custodia Ushiromiya Ange nel caso fosse apparsa.

Steam (ST): Ange had foreseen that and had {i:snatched it away}.
Umineko Project (UP): Ange had foreseen that and {i:snatched it away}.
PC Japanese (JP): それを先読みして、{i:掻っ攫った}。
Russian (RU): Энджи предвидела это и {i:лишила своих врагов преимущества}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ange já havia previsto isso e {i:contornado tudo}.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 緣壽預料到了此事，{i:火速鑽了空子}。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 缘寿预料到了此事，{i:火速钻了空子}。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ange lo aveva previsto e lo aveva stracciato.

Steam (ST): She had called herself Sumadera, and after cleverly tricking the man by saying her own subordinates would set up an ambush, so he didn't need to worry about it, she had taken him outside.
Umineko Project (UP): She had called herself Sumadera, and after skillfully tricking the man by saying her own subordinates would set up an ambush, she had taken him with her.
PC Japanese (JP): 自分が須磨寺だと名乗り、自分の部下が待ち伏せるからとまんまと騙し、男を連れ出したのだ。
Russian (RU): Она назвалась Сумадерой и, искусно обхитрив человека, сказав, что её подчинённые устроят засаду, выманила его наружу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela se identificou como Sumadera, e após o enganar habilmente e dizer que seus próprios subordinados estavam preparando uma emboscada, ela o levou junto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她自稱須磨寺，說自己的部下會留下埋伏，巧妙地騙出了教授。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她自称须磨寺，说自己的部下会留下埋伏，巧妙地骗出了教授。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Si era fatta chiamare Sumadera, e dopo aver abilmente ingannato l'uomo dicendo che i suoi subordinati avrebbero organizzato un'imboscata, lo aveva portato fuori.

Steam (ST): So, when the Sumadera family pursuers reached the professor's house, there was no longer anyone there...
Umineko Project (UP): So when the Sumadera pursuers reached the professor's house, there was no longer anyone there...
PC Japanese (JP): だから、須磨寺家の追っ手たちが教授宅に出向いた時には、すでに誰もいなかった…。
Russian (RU): Поэтому когда преследователи из семьи Сумадера прибыли в дом профессора, то никого там не застали...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, quando os perseguidores da Sumadera chegaram a casa do professor, ele já não estava mais lá...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，等須磨寺家的追兵趕到教授家時，已是人去樓空…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，等须磨寺家的追兵赶到教授家时，已是人去楼空…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Così quando gli inseguitori della famiglia Sumadera avevano raggiunto la casa del professore, non c'era più nessuno...

Steam (ST): "According to the family, a young man and woman calling themselves Sumadera visited this morning, took the professor out with them and still have not returned. ...There's a chance we were outmaneuvered."
Umineko Project (UP): "According to the family, a young man and woman calling themselves Sumadera visited this morning, took the professor out with them, and still have not returned. ......There is a chance we were outmaneuvered."
PC Japanese (JP): 「家人の話では、午前中に須磨寺を名乗る若い男女が訪れ、教授を連れ出したきりまだ帰宅しないそうです。……裏をかかれた可能性が。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「家人の話では、午前中に須磨寺を名乗る若い男女が訪れ、教授を連れ出したきりまだ帰宅しないそうです。……裏をかかれた可能性が」
Russian (RU): "Если верить словам членов семьи профессора, этим утром к нему пришли молодой человек и девушка, назвавшаяся Сумадерой, которая уговорила профессора пойти с ними, и он до сих пор не вернулся. ......Вполне вероятно, что нас обхитрили."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "De acordo com a família, um jovem homem e uma mulher dizendo serem parte dos Sumadera fizeram uma visita esta manhã, levaram o professor junto com eles, não tendo retornado ainda. ......Há uma chance de termos sidos passados para trás."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「據親屬講，上午來了一對自稱姓須磨寺的男女，帶走了教授，還沒有回來。……可能是被對方將計就計了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「据亲属讲，上午来了一对自称姓须磨寺的男女，带走了教授，还没有回来。……可能是被对方将计就计了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Secondo la famiglia, un giovane uomo e una donna che si facevano chiamare Sumadera hanno fatto visita quella mattina, trascinato il professore fuori con loro e ancora non sono tornati. ... C'è la possibilità che ci abbiano raggirati."

Speaker: Sumadera Kasumi
Steam (ST): ".........What a bad child, Ange-chan. ...I wonder if that craftiness is from Nee-san's blood. ...To think she'd casually take on the name Sumadera after saying she'd hate to go by it so often..."
Umineko Project (UP): "..................What a bad child that Ange‐chan is. ......I wonder if that craftiness is from Nee‐san's blood. ......To think that she would casually take on the name Sumadera after saying so often how she'd hate to call herself that..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………………いけない子ねぇ、縁寿ちゃんは。……そういう悪知恵、姉さんの血なのかしらねぇ。……あんなに名乗るのは嫌だと言ってた須磨寺の名を、気安く名乗ってくれちゃうなんて…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………………いけない子ねぇ、縁寿ちゃんは。……そういう悪知恵、姉さんの血なのかしらねぇ。……あんなに名乗るのは嫌だと言ってた須磨寺の名を、気安く名乗ってくれちゃうなんて…」
Russian (RU): "...............Что за несносный ребёнок эта Энджи‐чан. ......Уж не в мою ли сестру по изворотливости пошла. ......Подумать только, она спокойно взяла фамилию Сумадера, хотя в прошлом заявила, что ей претит называть себя так слишком часто..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "..................A Ange‐chan é mesmo uma criança malcriada. ......Me pergunto se essa astúcia veio do sangue da nee‐san. ......E pensar que ela iria casualmente usar do nome Sumadera depois de dizer tantas vezes que odiava ser chamada dessa forma..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………………好個不像話的孩子呢，小緣壽。……這種歪腦筋，倒也是出自姐姐的血脈吧。……竟把那麼不願用的須磨寺之名隨隨便便地報出口…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………………好个不像话的孩子呢，小缘寿。……这种歪脑筋，倒也是出自姐姐的血脉吧。……竟把那么不愿用的须磨寺之名随随便便地报出口…」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Che cattiva bambina, Ange-chan. ... Mi chiedo se questa furbizia venga dal sangue della mia Nee-san. ... Pensare che avrebbe preso senza alcuna cura il nome Sumadera dopo aver detto più e più volte che odiava farsi chiamare così...

Speaker: Sumadera Kasumi
Steam (ST): "......Hohohohohoh. ...The professor should be returning soon. When he does, we must serve him some tea..."
Umineko Project (UP): "............Hoh‐hoh‐hoh‐hoh‐ho. ...The professor should be returning soon. When he does, we must serve him some tea..."
PC Japanese (JP): ……………ほっほっほっほっほ。…その内、教授もお戻りになるだろうさ。そしたら、粗茶でも振舞わないとね…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……………ほっほっほっほっほ。…その内、教授もお戻りになるだろうさ。そしたら、粗茶でも振舞わないとね…」
Russian (RU): "............Хо‐хо‐хо‐хо. ...Профессор должен скоро вернуться. Когда вернётся, угостим‐ка его чаем..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............Hoh‐hoh‐hoh‐hoh‐ho. ...O professor deve retornar em breve. Quando ele voltar, devemos servir um pouco de chá a ele...?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……………呵呵呵呵呵。…再過會兒，教授就會回來吧。到時可得招待教授喝杯粗茶哦…？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……………呵呵呵呵呵。…再过会儿，教授就会回来吧。到时可得招待教授喝杯粗茶哦…？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Hoh-hoh-hoh-hoh-ho. ... Il professore dovrebbe fare ritorno a momenti. Quando lo fa, dobbiamo servirgli del tè..."

Steam (ST): "...Y-Yes. Understood."
Umineko Project (UP): "...Ye‐...yes. Understood."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…は、…はっ。了解しました。」
Russian (RU): "...Д‐да. Так точно."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...S‐Sim. Entendido."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…是、…是。明白了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... S... Sì. Ricevuto."

Speaker: Sumadera Kasumi
Steam (ST): "......I wonder if she thinks she's leading me around by the nose. What a naughty child. ......*giggle*giggle*, ...hohhohhohohohohohoho!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "..................I wonder if she thinks she's leading me around by the nose. She is such a naughty child. ............*giggle*giggle*, ......hoh‐hoh‐hoh‐ho{0}ho{0}ho{0}ho{0}hohoho!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………………私を手玉に取ったつもりかしら。やんちゃな子なんだから。…………くすくすくす、……ほっほっほほほほほほほ！！」
Russian (RU): "............Не возомнила ли она, будто водит меня за нос. Какая же она шалунья. ............*хи‐хи*хи‐хи*, хо‐хо‐хо‐хо‐хо‐хо‐хо!!!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "..................Me pergunto se ela acha que estou dançando na palma da sua mão. Ela é mesmo uma criança danada. ............*risos*risos*, ......hoh‐hoh‐hoh‐ho{0}ho{0}ho{0}ho{0}hohoho!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………………自以為耍了我麼？真是個調皮的孩子呢。…………哼哼哼，……呵、呵、呵呵呵呵呵呵呵！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………………自以为耍了我么？真是个调皮的孩子呢。…………哼哼哼，……呵、呵、呵呵呵呵呵呵呵！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Mi chiedo se pensa di starmi tirando per il naso. Lei è proprio una bambina birichina. ... *giggle*giggle*... hohhohhohohohohohoho!!"

Steam (ST): With a demonic look on her face, Kasumi violently stamped her heel.
Umineko Project (UP): With a demonic look on her face, Kasumi violently stamped her heel.
PC Japanese (JP): 霞は、般若のような形相をしながら踵を乱暴に踏み鳴らす。
Russian (RU): С исказившей лицо злой гримасой, Касуми с силой топнула каблуком.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com o demoníaco olhar de uma Hannya em seu rosto, Kasumi violentamente pisou vigorosamente contra o chão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 霞擺出副般若鬼面，粗暴地把腳後跟跺得砰砰響。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 霞摆出副般若鬼面，粗暴地把脚后跟跺得砰砰响。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Con un aspetto demoniaco sulla sua faccia, Kasumi pestò violentemente i tacchi.

Steam (ST): I'll teach you. About my Magic of Origins.
Umineko Project (UP): I'll teach you.{n}About my Magic of Origins.
PC Japanese (JP): 教えてあげる。真里亞の、原初の魔法を。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 教えてあげる。{n}真里亞の、原初の魔法を。
Russian (RU): Мария научит тебя.{n}Научит Магии Истока.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu irei ensiná‐la.{n}Sobre a minha Magia das Origens.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我來教給你。{n}真里亞的，原初的魔法。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我来教给你。{n}真里亚的，原初的魔法。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Maria ti insegnerà. Riguardo la sua Magia delle Origini.

Steam (ST): No, I taught you before, right? And you used it before. Did you forget...?
Umineko Project (UP): No, I taught you before, right?{n}And you used to be able to use it.{n}Did you forget......?
PC Japanese (JP): いいえ、教えたことがあったはず。そしてあなたにも使えたはずなんだよ。忘れちゃった……？
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): いいえ、教えたことがあったはず。{n}そしてあなたにも使えたはずなんだよ。{n}忘れちゃった……？
Russian (RU): Нет, ведь уже учила тебя раньше, так?{n}И ты пользовалась ею прежде, верно?{n}Ты забыла?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não, eu já ensinei isso a você antes, certo?{n}E você consumava ser capaz de usá‐la.{n}Você se esqueceu......?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不，我應該已經教過你了。{n}而且，你曾經應該也會使用。{n}忘記了嗎……？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不，我应该已经教过你了。{n}而且，你曾经应该也会使用。{n}忘记了吗……？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): No, te l'ha insegnato prima, giusto? E l'hai usata prima, giusto? Ti sei dimenticata...?

Steam (ST): You were also a witch apprentice, Ange, with your name entered into Mariage Sorcière, weren't you...?
Umineko Project (UP): You were also a witch apprentice, Ange, with your name entered into Mariage Sorcière, weren't you......?
PC Japanese (JP): 縁寿だって、マリアージュ・ソルシエールに名を連ねる、魔女の見習いでしょう……？
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 縁寿だって、マリアージュ・ソルシエールに名を連ねる、魔女の見習いだったでしょう……？
Russian (RU): Ты тоже была ученицей ведьмы, Энджи, а твоё имя было внесено в Меридж Сорсьер?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Você também é uma bruxa aprendiz, Ange, com seu nome sendo parte da Mariage Sorcière, não é mesmo......?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 緣壽也曾是，名列 Mariage Sorcière 的魔女見習吧……？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 缘寿也曾是，名列 Mariage Sorcière 的魔女见习吧……？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Eri anche tu un'apprendista strega, Ange, con il tuo nome inserito nella Mariage Sorciere, non è così...?

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "......I was also...included among the witches, wasn't I...?"
Umineko Project (UP): ".........I also...joined in as one of the witches, didn't I..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………私も、魔女に、加えてもらったんだっけ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………私も、魔女に、加えてもらったんだっけ」
Russian (RU): ".........Значит... я тоже была включена в круг ведьм..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Eu também...me juntei como sendo uma bruxa, não...?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………我也曾作為其中之一的魔女加入過來著。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………我也曾作为其中之一的魔女加入过来着。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Anch'io ero... inclusa nelle streghe, non è così..."

Steam (ST): I closed Maria's diary and flopped down on a very high-class-looking bed.
Umineko Project (UP): I closed Maria onee‐chan's diary and flopped down on a very high‐class‐looking bed.
PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞お姉ちゃんの日記を閉じ、ごろりと高級感溢れるベッドに身を横たえる。
Russian (RU): Я захлопнула дневник Марии и повалилась на шикарного вида кровать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu fechei o diário da Maria onee‐chan e deitei‐me em uma cama de aparência nobre.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 合上真里亞姐姐的日記，我躺到了滿溢高檔感的床上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 合上真里亚姐姐的日记，我躺到了满溢高档感的床上。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Chiusi il diario di Maria e lo buttai su un letto che sembrava di alta classe.

Steam (ST): I'd slept deeply for a long time in the car, so it took longer than usual for drowsiness to set in, and I read the diary as I waited.
Umineko Project (UP): Since I had fallen into a pretty deep sleep in the car, it was taking longer than usual for drowsiness to set in, and I had been spending a long time reading the diary as I waited for that.
PC Japanese (JP): 車中でずいぶんと深く眠ってしまった為、普段よりも眠気が訪れるのが遅く、それを待とうと、ずっと日記を読んでいたのだ。
Russian (RU): Поскольку я долгое время проспала в машине глубоким сном, у сонливости ушло больше времени, чтобы вступить в свои права, поэтому я читала дневник Марии в ожидании этого.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como eu havia caído em um sono profundo no carro, demorou mais tempo que o normal para ficar sonolenta, e acabei passando um longo tempo lendo o diário como se estivesse esperando por ele.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 由於在車上沉沉地睡了一覺，所以與平常相比，睡意遲遲不來，為了等它到來，我讀了好一會兒日記。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 由于在车上沉沉地睡了一觉，所以与平常相比，睡意迟迟不来，为了等它到来，我读了好一会儿日记。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dato che ho dormito profondamente per molto tempo in macchina, ci volle molto più tempo perché arrivasse la sonnolenza, e avevo letto il diario mentre aspettavo che arrivasse.

Steam (ST): This was a super expensive hotel in the city. ...Since it was often used by the rich and the famous, they were very big on confidentiality.
Umineko Project (UP): This was a super‐expensive hotel in the city. ...Expensive hotels that are often used by the rich and famous have an abnormally strong duty of confidentiality, out of concern for their various circumstances.
PC Japanese (JP): ここは都内の超高級ホテル。…著名人や富豪が使用することも多いような高級ホテルは、彼らの事情に配慮し、非常に守秘義務が強い。
Russian (RU): Это был бешено дорогой отель в городе. ...Ну а поскольку в этом дорогущем отеле частенько останавливались богатые и знаменитые, то стремясь угодить им, там соблюдали строгую политику конфиденциальности гостей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Este é um hotel extremamente caro dessa cidade. ...Hotéis caros que costumam ser frequentados muitas vezes por pessoas ricas e famosas tendem a ter um forte e anormal dever de confidencialidade, sem se preocupar com suas variadas circunstâncias.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 此處是東京都內的超高級酒店。…這間常有著名人士與富豪入住的高級酒店，為了保障他們的隱私，非常注重保密。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 此处是东京都内的超高级酒店。…这间常有著名人士与富豪入住的高级酒店，为了保障他们的隐私，非常注重保密。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Questo è un hotel super costoso in città. ... Dato che questo costoso hotel è usato spesso da personaggi ricchi e famosi, senza preoccuparsi delle loro condizioni, aveva un anormale senso del dovere di riservatezza.

Steam (ST): That made it very convenient for Ange to escape her pursuers.
Umineko Project (UP): This made it a very convenient place for Ange, on the run from her pursuers.
PC Japanese (JP): その為、追っ手から逃亡している縁寿にとってはとても都合が良かった。
Russian (RU): Поэтому он замечательно подходил Энджи, чтобы укрыться от преследователей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Isto fez dele um local muito conveniente para Ange, que estava fugindo de seus perseguidores.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因此，對正在逃避追兵的緣壽來說，此處正合適。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因此，对正在逃避追兵的缘寿来说，此处正合适。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Questo lo rendeva molto conveniente per Ange per scappare dai suoi inseguitori.

Steam (ST): The idea that renegades should spend their nights hiding in cheap hotels is a commoner's way of thinking.
Umineko Project (UP): The idea that runaways spend their nights hiding in cheap hotels is a commoner's way of thinking.
PC Japanese (JP): 逃亡者は隠れるように安宿に泊まる、というのは庶民の考えだ。
Russian (RU): Мысль, что отщепенец проведёт ночь, прячась в дешёвом отеле, свойственна простолюдинам.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A ideia de fugir passando noites em hotéis baratos é uma forma muito comum de se pensar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所謂“逃亡者會躲躲藏藏地找便宜小旅館住”，乃是平民百姓的想法。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所谓“逃亡者会躲躲藏藏地找便宜小旅馆住”，乃是平民百姓的想法。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): L'idea che una scappata di casa spendesse la notte a nascondersi in un hotel economico è un modo comune di pensare.

Steam (ST): ...To Ange, who possessed all the wealth of the Ushiromiya family, renegade life was comfortable indeed.
Umineko Project (UP): ......For Ange, who possessed all the wealth of the Ushiromiya family, the life of a runaway was truly comfortable.
PC Japanese (JP): ……右代宮家の財産の全てを持つ縁寿にとっては、実に快適な逃亡生活だった。
Russian (RU): ......Энджи, владеющей богатством семьи Уширомия, было приятно вести жизнь отщепенки.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Para Ange, que detinha de toda a fortuna da família Ushiromiya, a vida de fugitiva era verdadeiramente confortável.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……對於擁有右代宮家全部財產的緣壽來說，逃亡生活實在是輕鬆舒適。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……对于拥有右代宫家全部财产的缘寿来说，逃亡生活实在是轻松舒适。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Per Ange, che possedeva tutta l'eredità della famiglia Ushiromiya, la vita da scappata di casa era davvero piacevole.

Steam (ST): Of course, even though he was a guard, Amakusa was a man and therefore in a separate room. Ange used the bedroom of the suite, and Amakusa lay on the sofa in the living room.
Umineko Project (UP): Of course, as a man, Amakusa was in a separate room despite being her guard. Ange was using the bedroom of the suite, while Amakusa was lying down on the living room sofa.
PC Japanese (JP): もちろん、護衛とはいえ、男の天草は別室。スイートルームの寝室を縁寿が使い、居間のソファーに天草は横になっている。
Russian (RU): Что же касается Амакусы, то тот, будучи телохранителем, также являлся и мужчиной, поэтому ему была отведена своя комната. Энджи пользовалась спальней в номере, тогда как Амакуса облюбовал диван в гостиной.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É claro, como homem, Amakusa estava em um quarto separado, apesar de ser seu guarda. Ange estava usando a cama da suíte, enquanto Amakusa estava deitado no sofá da sala.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖說是保鏢，身為男人的天草當然是用了別的房間。套房寢室歸緣壽，而天草則躺在了起居室的沙發上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽说是保镖，身为男人的天草当然是用了别的房间。套房寝室归缘寿，而天草则躺在了起居室的沙发上。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Certamente, anche se era una guardia, Amakusa era un uomo e in una stanza separata. Ange usava il letto della suite e Amakusa stava sul divano nel salotto.

Steam (ST): ...According to Amakusa, the sofas here were more pleasant than his own beds had been recently. Poor guy.
Umineko Project (UP): ...Amakusa said something about how the sofa here was more comfortable than his own bed recently. Poor guy.
PC Japanese (JP): …天草曰く、今の自分のベッドより、ここのソファーの方が快適だとか。気の毒な話だ。
Russian (RU): ...Он даже отметил, что последнее время на диване было даже удобней, чем на его собственной кровати. Бедняга.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...O Amakusa havia dito algo sobre como os sofás daqui eram mais confortáveis que a cama dele. Coitado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …天草說了，比起現在自己的床，還是那兒的沙發要更舒適。真難為他了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …天草说了，比起现在自己的床，还是那儿的沙发要更舒适。真难为他了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Amakusa aveva detto qualcosa riguardo come quel divano fosse più piacevole del suo stesso letto recentemente. Povero ragazzo.

Steam (ST): When I looked at the clock, ...I saw that it was almost 2:00 in the middle of the night.
Umineko Project (UP): When I looked at the clock, ......I saw that it was almost 2 a.m.
PC Japanese (JP): 時計を見ると、……深夜の２時を間近にしている。
Russian (RU): Взглянув на часы, я увидела, что те показывают 2 часа ночи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando eu olhei para o relógio, ......percebi que já eram quase duas horas da manhã.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 看了下表，……快到深夜兩點了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 看了下表，……快到深夜两点了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando guardai l'orologio... vidi che erano quasi le 2:00 nel bel mezzo della notte.

Steam (ST): I'm still not getting sleepy. ......I sighed deeply.
Umineko Project (UP): Still not getting sleepy. ............I sighed deeply.
PC Japanese (JP): まだ眠くならない。…………はぁ、っとため息を漏らす。
Russian (RU): Но сон всё ещё обходил меня стороной. ............Я глубоко вздохнула.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ainda não consigo dormir. ............Eu suspirei profundamente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 還是睡不著。…………我哈啊地長吁了一口氣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 还是睡不着。…………我哈啊地长吁了一口气。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ancora non ho sonno. ... Sospirai sommessamente.

Steam (ST): At that time, even though there was no wind, I had the feeling that Maria onee-chan's diary fluttered.
Umineko Project (UP): Even though there was no wind, I suddenly got the feeling that Maria onee‐chan's diary had fluttered open.
PC Japanese (JP): その時、風もないのに、真里亞お姉ちゃんの日記が、ぱらりと捲れた気がした。
Russian (RU): И тут, хотя никакого ветра не было, мне показалось, словно страницы в дневнике Марии онее‐чан зашелестели.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo não havendo vento, eu repentinamente tive a sensação de que o diário da Maria onee‐chan havia se aberto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就在此時，明明沒有風，我卻感到真里亞姐姐的日記嘩地翻開了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就在此时，明明没有风，我却感到真里亚姐姐的日记哗地翻开了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): A quel punto, anche se non c'era vento, avevo il presentimento che il diario di Maria Onee-chan stesse fluttuando.

Steam (ST): ...Then, Onee-chan appeared. Her form was no longer the normal one I'd known.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Then, Onee‐chan appeared.{n}Her form was no longer the normal one that I knew.
PC Japanese (JP): ……そして、お姉ちゃんが姿を現す。その姿はもう、私が知るいつもの姿ではない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……そして、お姉ちゃんが姿を現す。{n}その姿はもう、私が知るいつもの姿ではない。
Russian (RU): ......А затем возникла сама сестричка.{n}Её облик был уже не тот, который я знала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Então, a onee‐chan apareceu.{n}A sua forma não era mais como eu lembrava ser.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……然後，姐姐冒了出來。{n}她的著裝不是我所熟悉的一直以來的那身服裝。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……然后，姐姐冒了出来。{n}她的着装不是我所熟悉的一直以来的那身服装。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Poi, Onee-chan apparve. Il suo aspetto non era più quello normale che conoscevo.

Steam (ST): ...She was wearing the dress that {f:5:Beatrice} had given her after acknowledging her as a witch.
Umineko Project (UP): ...She was wearing the dress that {f:5:Beatrice} had given her after acknowledging her status as a witch.
PC Japanese (JP): …ベアトリーチェに、魔女としての格を認められて与えられたドレスを身に纏っている。
Russian (RU): ...На ней было надето платье, подаренное ей {f:5:Беатриче} после того, как та признала её ведьмой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Ela estava vestindo o vestido que a {f:5:Beatrice} deu a ela depois de reconhecer seus status como bruxa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …姐姐穿著，貝阿朵莉切認可她作為魔女的資格，所贈予的禮服。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …姐姐穿着，贝阿朵莉切认可她作为魔女的资格，所赠予的礼服。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Stava indossando il vestito che Beatrice le aveva donato dopo averla riconosciuta come strega.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Steam (ST): "......If you don't get some sleep, it'll be tough tomorrow, right?"
Umineko Project (UP): ".........If you don't get some sleep, it'll be tough tomorrow, you know?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………もう寝ないと、明日が辛いよ？」
Russian (RU): ".........Если ты сейчас не поспишь, то завтра тебе придётся нелегко, так ведь?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Se não dormir um pouco, amanhã vai ser bem difícil, sabia?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………再不睡，明天會吃不消喲？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………再不睡，明天会吃不消哟？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Se non dormi un po', sarà dura domani, giusto?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "If I were a witch too, ...I'd be able to use magic, wouldn't I?"
Umineko Project (UP): "If I were a witch too, ......I could use magic, right?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「私も、魔女なら。……魔法が使えるのよね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「私も、魔女なら。……魔法が使えるのよね」
Russian (RU): "Будь я тоже ведьмой... я бы смогла использовать магию, не так ли."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Se eu também fosse uma bruxa, ......poderia usar magia, certo?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我若也是魔女。……就能使用魔法吧？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Se fossi anch'io una strega... sarei in grado di usare la magia, non è vero."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Steam (ST): "...Yeah. You can use it. I taught you, didn't I? Taught you how to use it. ...And you were able to use it in the past, weren't you?"
Umineko Project (UP): "...Yep. Could. I taught you, didn't I? How to use it. ......And you were able to, once."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…うん。使えるよ。教えてあげたでしょ？　使い方。……昔は使えたはずだよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…うん。使えるよ。教えてあげたでしょ？　使い方。……昔は使えたはずだよ」
Russian (RU): "...Да. Ты можешь использовать её. Мария ведь научила тебя, верно? Как колдовать. ......И ты вполне могла пользоваться магией в прошлом."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Sim. Poderia. Eu ensinei a você, não ensinei? Como usá‐la. ......E você foi capaz de usar, uma vez."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…嗯。能用喲。有教過你吧？用法。……以前你應該會用喲。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…嗯。能用哟。有教过你吧？用法。……以前你应该会用哟。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Sì. Tu puoi usarla. Maria ti ha insegnato, giusto? Come usarla. {n}E apparentemente eri in grado di usarla in passato."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "......I remember. ...I've started wanting to use it."
Umineko Project (UP): "...............I remember. ......I've started wanting to."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……………覚えてる。……使いたくなった。」
Russian (RU): "............Я помню. ......У меня начинает возникать желание пользоваться ею."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...............Eu lembro. ......Eu comecei a querer."
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Mi ricordo. ... Ho cominciato a voler usarla."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Steam (ST): "Are you starting to feel lonely...?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Did you get lonely...?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「寂しくなった…？」
Russian (RU): "Тебе одиноко?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você ficou solitária...?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「感到寂寞了…？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Non ti senti sola...?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): ".........Not really. ...It's not like having a different pillow every night is that tough."
Umineko Project (UP): "..................Not really. ......It's not like having a different pillow every night is that tough."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………………別に。……毎日、枕が違うくらいのことで辛くなんてならないわ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………………別に。……毎日、枕が違うくらいのことで辛くなんてならないわ」
Russian (RU): "..................Не думаю. ......Едва ли новая подушка каждую ночь может выбить из колеи."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "..................Não. ......Não é como usar um travesseiro diferente todas as noites fosse algo difícil."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………………不算是。……每天睡不同的枕頭才算不上辛酸呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………………不算是。……每天睡不同的枕头才算不上辛酸呢。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Non proprio. ... Non è che avere un differente cuscino ogni notte sia così dura."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Steam (ST): "......The first step to magic can be loneliness or boredom, ...even small reasons like that."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........The first step to magic can be loneliness, or boredom, or any reason as small as that."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………魔法の最初の一歩は、寂しいからとか、退屈だからとか、そのくらいのささやかな理由でいいの。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………魔法の最初の一歩は、寂しいからとか、退屈だからとか、そのくらいのささやかな理由でいいの」
Russian (RU): ".........Первым шагом к магии может послужить одиночество или скука, либо любая подобная скромная причина."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........O primeiro passo para a magia pode ser a solidão ou o tédio, ou qualquer outra razão ainda mais insignificante."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………魔法最初的一步，去以因為寂寞呀、因為無聊呀，這種細小的理由就足夠了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………魔法最初的一步，去以因为寂寞呀、因为无聊呀，这种细小的理由就足够了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Il primo passo verso la magia può essere la solitudine o la noia, o qualche altra ragione piccola come quelle."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "Even if it's just trying to kill time until you can fall asleep?"
Umineko Project (UP): "Even killing time until you get tired?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「眠くなるまでの暇潰しだとしても？」
Russian (RU): "Даже попытка убить время, пока не уснёшь?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Mesmo matar o tempo até você ficar cansada?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「為了在想睡前解解悶也行？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「为了在想睡前解解闷也行？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Anche tentare di passare il tempo prima di prender sonno?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Steam (ST): "Yeah. I'm glad you remembered about magic one more time."
Umineko Project (UP): "Yep. I'm happy that you remembered about magic one more time."
PC Japanese (JP): 「うん。縁寿がもう一度魔法のことを思い出してくれて、真里亞は嬉しい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「うん。縁寿がもう一度魔法のことを思い出してくれて、真里亞は嬉しい」
Russian (RU): "Да. Мария счастлива, что Энджи вспомнила про магию ещё один раз."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim. Fico feliz que você lembrou da magia mais uma vez."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「嗯。緣壽能再次想起魔法，真里亞很高興。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「嗯。缘寿能再次想起魔法，真里亚很高兴。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sì. Maria è felice che Ange si sia ricordata della magia ancora una volta."

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Chinese Traditional (CHT): [=JP]
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=JP]

Steam (ST): ...It's been quite a long time since I last used magic.
Umineko Project (UP): ......It's been quite a long time since I last used magic.
PC Japanese (JP): ……魔法を使うのは、ずいぶん久し振り。
Russian (RU): ......Немало воды утекло с тех пор, как я в последний раз пользовалась магией.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Já faz um bom tempo desde a última vez em que eu usei magia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……我有好久好久沒去用魔法了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……我有好久好久没去用魔法了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... È passato un bel po' di tempo dall'ultima volta che ho usato la magia.

Steam (ST): At one point, with Maria onee-chan's introduction, ...I touched a corner of it...and opened the door a tiny bit.
Umineko Project (UP): At one point, with Maria onee‐chan's introduction, ......I touched a corner of it, and opened the door a tiny bit.
PC Japanese (JP): 一時、真里亞お姉ちゃんの手解きで、……その一端に触れ、扉をわずかに開けたことがある。
Russian (RU): В то время, под руководством Марии онее‐чан... я лишь коснулась её уголка и на самую малость приоткрыла дверь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em determinado momento, com a introdução da Maria onee‐chan, ......eu toquei a ponta dela e abri levemente essa porta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 曾有一段時間，我受真里亞姐姐啟蒙，……接觸到了魔法的一角，微微推開過門。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 曾有一段时间，我受真里亚姐姐启蒙，……接触到了魔法的一角，微微推开过门。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): A quel punto, con l'introduzione di Maria Onee-chan... ne toccai un angolo, e aprì un poco la porta.

Steam (ST): So, ...I should still remember that sensation.
Umineko Project (UP): So, ......I should still remember that sensation.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、……まだあの感覚は覚えているはず。
Russian (RU): Поэтому... я всё ещё должна помнить то ощущение.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, ......eu ainda devo lembrar daquela sensação.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，……我應該還記得那種感覺。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，……我应该还记得那种感觉。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Così... dovrei ancora ricordare quella sensazione.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Steam (ST): "...Right now, your magical power has declined significantly, Ange. ...If you don't devote yourself to the basics, it'll be hard, okay?"
Umineko Project (UP): "......Right now, your magical power has declined significantly, Ange. ...If you don't stick to the basics, it'll be hard, okay?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……今の縁寿は、かなり魔法の力は衰えてる。…基本に忠実じゃないと、難しいよ？」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……今の縁寿は、かなり魔法の力が衰えてる。…基本に忠実じゃないと、難しいよ？」

Umineko Project (UP): Then I started fishing through my knapsack.{n}...Looking for anything that might make a good vessel.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、ごそごそとナップザックの中身を漁る。…何か適当な、依り代になりそうなものはないか。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そして、ごそごそとナップザックの中身を漁る。{n}…何か適当な、依り代になりそうなものはないか。
Russian (RU): Затем я принялась рыться в рюкзаке.{n}...Я надеялась найти что‐нибудь, что может сойти за хороший сосуд.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, eu comecei a procurar coisas na minha mochila.{n}...Procurando por qualquer coisa que poderia ser um bom receptáculo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後，我咔嚓咔嚓地翻找起了背包中的東西。{n}…有沒有什麼，能拿來當依代的東西呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后，我咔嚓咔嚓地翻找起了背包中的东西。{n}…有没有什么，能拿来当依代的东西呢？
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Poi cominciai a pescare nello zaino. ... Cercando qualcosa che potesse essere un buon medium.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "......Shouldn't this be a perfect vessel?"
Umineko Project (UP): "............Wouldn't this be perfect for a vessel?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「…………これなら、依り代にはぴったりじゃない？」
Russian (RU): ".........Не сгодится ли это?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............Isso não seria perfeito para um receptáculo?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…………這個當依代，不是正合適？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…………这个当依代，不是正合适？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Non dovrebbe essere un medium perfetto questo?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Steam (ST): "It's been a long time. ...Yes. With this, I think even you should be able to perform a summons as you are now. ...And they have no master now. It should be possible for you to become their new master, Ange."
Umineko Project (UP): "It's been so long since I saw that. ......Yeah. I think even as you are now, you should be able to summon that one. ...And she has no master now. It should be possible for you to become her new master, Ange."
PC Japanese (JP): 「懐かしい。……うん。それならば、今の縁寿でも召喚できると思うよ。…それには今、主がいない。縁寿が新しい主になるのも可能なはず。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「懐かしい。……うん。それならば、今の縁寿でも召喚できると思うよ。…それには今、主がいない。縁寿が新しい主になるのも可能なはず」
Russian (RU): "Прошло немало времени. ......Да. Да, с помощью этого ты сможешь провести призыв даже будучи такой, какая сейчас. ...Вдобавок, у них сейчас нет господина. Для тебя вполне возможно стать их новой хозяйкой, Энджи."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Já faz tanto tempo que vi isso. ......Sim. Acredito que como você está agora, seja capaz de invocar isto. ...E ela não tem um mestre no momento. É possível que você se torne seu novo mestre, Ange."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「好懷念呢。……嗯。我覺得，這個的話，即便是現在的緣壽，也能將之召喚出來哦。…而且她現在無主。緣壽理應有可能當上她的新主人哦。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「好怀念呢。……嗯。我觉得，这个的话，即便是现在的缘寿，也能将之召唤出来哦。…而且她现在无主。缘寿理应有可能当上她的新主人哦。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "È passato un bel po' di tempo. ... Sì. Con questo, credo che anche tu saresti in grado di effettuare un'evocazione nello stato in cui sei. ... E loro non hanno più un padrone ora. Potrebbe essere possibile per te diventarne la nuova padrona, Ange."

Steam (ST): Among the things that looked like good vessels, I took the one I thought might possess the strongest magical power... and set it on the side table near the bed with a clatter.
Umineko Project (UP): Among the things that looked like good vessels, I took the one I thought might possess the strongest magical power, and set it on the side table near the bed with a clunk.
PC Japanese (JP): 依り代になりそうなものの中で、もっとも強い魔力を有するだろうと思うそれを、ゴトリと、ベッド脇のサイドテーブルに置く。
Russian (RU): Среди вещей, из которых могли получиться хорошие сосуды, я выбрала тот, который, по моему мнению, был наделён самой большой магической силой, и со стуком положила его на приставной столик рядом с кроватью.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Dentre as coisas que eu procurei para servir de receptáculo, peguei uma na qual eu pensei que tivesse o poder mágico mais poderoso, e a coloquei no criado mudo ao lado da cama.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我將自我感覺能當依代之物中，具有最強魔力的那個東西，“砰”地放到了床邊的桌上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我将自我感觉能当依代之物中，具有最强魔力的那个东西，“砰”地放到了床边的桌上。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tra le cose che sembravano essere un buon medium, presi quello che pensavo potesse avere il potere magico più forte, e lo misi sul lato del tavolo vicino al letto con un tintinnio.

Steam (ST): It was...a shady-looking, stake-shaped weapon with an occult design inscribed on it.
Umineko Project (UP): It was......a shady‐looking stake‐shaped weapon embellished with an occult design.
PC Japanese (JP): それは、……オカルト的な装飾を施された、物騒な杭状の武器。
Russian (RU): Этот предмет представлял собой... подозрительно выглядящее оружие в форме кола с оккультным рисунком на нём.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era......uma arma na forma de uma estaca, com uma aparência sombria, adornada com um design oculto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那是一根，……施與了神秘學風格裝飾的，嚇人的樁狀武器。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那是一根，……施与了神秘学风格装饰的，吓人的桩状武器。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era... un'arma dall'aspetto oscuro e a forma di pugnale con inciso un motivo occulto.

Steam (ST): It was one of the "Seven Stakes of Purgatory", which the witch used to offer sacrifices.
Umineko Project (UP): A stake of the "Seven Stakes of Purgatory", used by witches to offer sacrifices.
PC Japanese (JP): “煉獄の七杭”と呼ばれる、魔女が生贄を捧げるための杭だ。
Russian (RU): Это был кинжал — один из семи кинжалов чистилища, которыми ведьма пользовалась для жертвоприношений.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Uma estaca das "Sete Estacas do Purgatório", usada por bruxas para oferecer sacrifícios.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 此乃被稱為“煉獄七樁”的，為魔女獻上活祭所用的樁。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 此乃被称为“炼狱七桩”的，为魔女献上活祭所用的桩。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Era un pugnale dei ‘Sette Pugnali del Purgatorio’, che la strega aveva usato per compiere sacrifici.

Steam (ST): When the police had been searching the family's possessions, they had collected a large amount of junk. After the investigation had finished, these had been politely returned to the Ushiromiya family.
Umineko Project (UP): In the course of their search for evidence, the police had collected a large amount of junk.{n}After the investigation had finished, this had been faithfully returned to the Ushiromiya family.
PC Japanese (JP): 警察は遺留品捜索の際、大量のガラクタを収集。それらは律儀にも捜査終了後、右代宮家に返却された。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 警察は遺留品捜索の際、大量のガラクタを収集。{n}それらは律儀にも捜査終了後、右代宮家に返却された。
Russian (RU): Когда полиция проводила обыск среди принадлежащих семье вещей, они насобирали огромное количество предметов, к которым можно было применить эпитет "мусор".{n}По завершении расследования их вежливо вернули семье Уширомия.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Na busca por evidências, a polícia coletou uma grande quantidade de evidências sem valor. Depois que a investigação terminou, isso foi fielmente devolvido à família Ushiromiya.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 警察在搜索遺物時，收集到了一大堆沒用的玩意兒。{n}在搜查結束後，警察守規矩地把這些東西還給了右代宮家。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 警察在搜索遗物时，收集到了一大堆没用的玩意儿。{n}在搜查结束后，警察守规矩地把这些东西还给了右代宫家。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quando la polizia aveva ispezionato i possedimenti della famiglia, avevano raccolto un mucchio di paccottiglia. Dopo che l'investigazione era finita, queste erano state educatamente restituite alla famiglia Ushiromiya.

Steam (ST): ...Finding something that I'd seen in the pictures of Maria's diary, I took it home with me.
Umineko Project (UP): ......I found something there that I had seen in the illustrations in Maria's diary, and took it home with me.
PC Japanese (JP): ……その中に、真里亞の日記に記されていた挿絵で見たことのあるものを見つけ、持ち帰ったのだ。
Russian (RU): ......Я нашла нечто, что видела на картинках в дневника Марии, и забрала с собой домой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Eu encontrei algo no meio de tudo que se parecia com as ilustrações no diário da Maria, e peguei para mim.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……在這之中，我發現了在真里亞日記中的插圖上見過之物，帶了回來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……在这之中，我发现了在真里亚日记中的插图上见过之物，带了回来。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Trovai qualcosa che avevo visto nelle immagini del diario di Maria, e lo portai a casa con me.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Steam (ST): "......Originally, there were Seven Stakes of Purgatory. ...How pitiful. Now, she's the only one left."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Originally, the Seven Stakes of Purgatory were a seven‐piece set. ......Poor girl. She's the only one left now."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………煉獄の七杭は、元々、７本で一揃いだった。……気の毒にね。今はもう、彼女１本だけ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………煉獄の七杭は、元々、７本で一揃いだった。……気の毒にね。今はもう、彼女１本だけ」
Russian (RU): ".........Изначально кинжалов было семь. ......Какая жалость. Теперь остался лишь один."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Originalmente, as Sete Estacas do Purgatório eram um conjunto de sete peças. ......Coitada. Ela é a única que restou."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………煉獄七樁本為七根一套。……好可怜。現在，就只剩她一根了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………炼狱七桩本为七根一套。……好可怜。现在，就只剩她一根了。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Originariamente, c'erano sette dei Sette Pugnali del Purgatorio. {n}Che peccato. Ora, questo è l'ultimo rimasto."

Steam (ST): Onee-chan smiled, looking lonely...
Umineko Project (UP): Onee‐chan smiled, looking lonely...
PC Japanese (JP): お姉ちゃんは寂しそうに微笑む…。
Russian (RU): Сестричка улыбнулась, но эта улыбка придала ей одинокий вид...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A onee‐chan sorriu, com uma aparência solitária...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 姐姐露出了略帶寂寞的微笑…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 姐姐露出了略带寂寞的微笑…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Onee-chan sorrise, sembrando triste...

Steam (ST): I pulled another book out of the knapsack.
Umineko Project (UP): I pulled another book out of the knapsack.
PC Japanese (JP): 私はナップザックから、もう一冊の本を取り出す。
Russian (RU): Я извлекла другую книгу из рюкзака.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu puxei outro livro da minha mochila.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我從背包中又取出了一本書。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我从背包中又取出了一本书。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tirai fuori un altro libro dallo zaino.

Steam (ST): ...This was also old-fashioned, and you could tell that it was an occult book just by looking.
Umineko Project (UP): ......This was another old‐fashioned, blatantly occult‐related book.
PC Japanese (JP): ……これまた古めかしい、見るからにオカルト的な本。
Russian (RU): ......Она выглядела старой и из её облика можно было сделать вывод, что это оккультная книга.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Era outro livro antigo, claramente relacionado ao ocultismo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……這同樣是一本古色古香，一看就帶有神秘學色彩的書。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……这同样是一本古色古香，一看就带有神秘学色彩的书。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Anche questo aveva un aspetto antiquato, e avresti potuto dire che era un libro dell'occulto semplicemente guardandolo.

Steam (ST): But its contents were plain. It was one of Maria onee-chan's elaborate notebooks.
Umineko Project (UP): But this, too, was a book to be written in.{n}It was one of Maria onee‐chan's elaborate notebooks.
PC Japanese (JP): しかしこれも中身は無地のもの。真里亞お姉ちゃんの凝ったノートの内の一冊だ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): しかしこれも中身は無地のもの。{n}真里亞お姉ちゃんの凝ったノートの内の一冊だ。
Russian (RU): Однако содержание её было незамысловатым.{n}Это была одна из диковинных тетрадей Марии онее‐чан.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas este também era um livro para ser escrito.{n}Era um dos elaborados cadernos da Maria onee‐chan.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，在封皮之下，也是普通的白紙。{n}這是真里亞姐姐那些精緻的筆記本中的一本。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，在封皮之下，也是普通的白纸。{n}这是真里亚姐姐那些精致的笔记本中的一本。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma i suoi contenuti erano modesti. Era uno degli elaborati taccuini di Maria Onee-chan.

Steam (ST): This wasn't a diary. ...This was a grimoire, which she had written as a witch.
Umineko Project (UP): This one was not a diary.{n}......It was a grimoire, which she had written as a witch.
PC Japanese (JP): こちらは日記ではない。……彼女が魔女として記した、魔導書。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): こちらは日記ではない。{n}……彼女が魔女として記した、魔導書。
Russian (RU): Также это был не дневник,{n}а гримуар, написанный ею как ведьмой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Este não era um diário.{n}......Era um grimório, que ela escreveu como uma bruxa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這本並不是日記。{n}……而是她身為魔女，所寫下的魔導書。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这本并不是日记。{n}……而是她身为魔女，所写下的魔导书。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Questo non era un diario. ... Questo era un grimorio, che lei aveva scritto come strega.

Steam (ST): The Seven Stakes of Purgatory are {f:5:Beatrice}'s furniture. Created by her and employed only for her sake.
Umineko Project (UP): The Seven Stakes of Purgatory were {f:5:Beatrice}'s furniture.{n}Created by her and employed only for her sake.
PC Japanese (JP): 煉獄の七杭は、ベアトリーチェの家具。彼女が生み出し、彼女のためだけに使役される。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 煉獄の七杭は、ベアトリーチェの家具。{n}彼女が生み出し、彼女のためだけに使役される。
Russian (RU): Семь кинжалов чистилища являлись мебелью {f:5:Беатриче}.{n}Они были созданы ею и взяты себе на службу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As Sete Estacas do Purgatório eram mobílias da {f:5:Beatrice}.{n}Criadas por ela para servir apenas a si.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 煉獄七樁是貝阿朵莉切的家具。{n}由她創造，僅會為她受使役。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 炼狱七桩是贝阿朵莉切的家具。{n}由她创造，仅会为她受使役。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): I Sette Pugnali del Purgatorio sono mobili di Beatrice. Creati da lei e usati solo per il suo interesse.

Steam (ST): But since {f:5:Beatrice} is also a witch of Mariage Sorcière, they could be employed by {f:5:Maria}, a witch of the same alliance.
Umineko Project (UP): But since {f:5:Beatrice} was a witch of Mariage Sorcière, they could also be employed by {f:5:Maria}, who was a witch of the same alliance.
PC Japanese (JP): でも、ベアトリーチェは、マリアージュ・ソルシエールの魔女でもあるから、同盟の魔女であるマリアにも使役できる。
Russian (RU): Но поскольку {f:5:Беатриче} также являлась ведьмой Меридж Сорсьер, то они могли стать на службу {f:5:Марие}, тоже входящей в этот альянс.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas como {f:5:Beatrice} era uma bruxa da Mariage Sorcière, elas também poderiam servir à {f:5:Maria}, que era uma bruxa da mesma aliança.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，由於貝阿朵莉切是 Mariage Sorcière 的魔女，所以身為同盟魔女的瑪利亞也可使役她們辦事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，由于贝阿朵莉切是 Mariage Sorcière 的魔女，所以身为同盟魔女的玛利亚也可使役她们办事。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma dato che Beatrice è anche una strega della Mariage Sorciere, possono essere usati da MARIA, che è una strega della stessa alleanza.

Steam (ST): For that reason, the method of summoning the Seven Stakes of Purgatory and how to handle them was written about in great detail in Maria onee-chan's grimoire...
Umineko Project (UP): For that reason, the method of summoning the Seven Stakes of Purgatory and how to handle them was written about in great detail in Maria onee‐chan's grimoire...
PC Japanese (JP): その為、真里亞お姉ちゃんの魔導書に、煉獄の七杭たちの召喚方法や、その取り扱いなどが事細かに記されているのだ…。
Russian (RU): Поэтому метод призыва семи кинжалов чистилища и описание обращения с ними были подробно изложены в гримуаре Марии онее‐чан...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por causa disso, o método para a invocação das Sete Estacas do Purgatório e a forma como lidar com elas estava detalhadamente escrita no grimório da Maria onee‐chan...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因此，在真里亞姐姐的魔導書裡，詳盡記述著煉獄七樁的召喚方法，及如何對待她們的注意事項…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因此，在真里亚姐姐的魔导书里，详尽记述着炼狱七桩的召唤方法，及如何对待她们的注意事项…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Per quella ragione, il metodo di come evocare i Sette Pugnali del Purgatorio e come gestirli era descritto con grande dettaglio nel grimorio di Maria Onee-chan...

Steam (ST): And... ...As another person with their name registered in that alliance, I was also permitted to employ them.
Umineko Project (UP): And...as another person with her name in the same alliance, I was also permitted to employ them.
PC Japanese (JP): そして。…同じ同盟に名を連ねる私にも、使役は許されているのだ。
Russian (RU): И. ...Будучи особой, чьё имя числилось в упомянутом альянсе, мне тоже дозволялось призвать их себе на службу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E...sendo alguém na qual seu nome faz parte da mesma aliança, também era permitido a mim o direito de empregá‐las.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 另外。…名列同一同盟的我，也被允許使役她們。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 另外。…名列同一同盟的我，也被允许使役她们。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): E... come altra persona ad avere il proprio nome nella stessa alleanza, anche a me era concesso ingaggiarli.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "......Which... ...of the Seven Sisters is this stake?"
Umineko Project (UP): ".........This stake is............which of the Seven Sisters?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………この杭は、…………七姉妹の誰？」
Russian (RU): ".........Этот кинжал... Какой из сестёр он является?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Esta estaca é............de qual das Sete Irmãs?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………這根樁是，…………七姐妹中的誰？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………这根桩是，…………七姐妹中的谁？」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Questo pugnale... quale è delle Sette Sorelle?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Steam (ST): "Their characteristics are written about well in my grimoire. ...The Sisters of the Seven Stakes really hate it when you get their names wrong. Remember their names well before summoning them."
Umineko Project (UP): "Their characteristics are well described in my grimoire. ...The Sisters of the Seven Stakes really hate it when you get their names wrong. Remember their names well before summoning them."
PC Japanese (JP): 「真里亞の魔導書に、彼女らの特徴がよく記されてるよ。…七杭の姉妹は、名前を間違えられることをとても嫌う。召喚する前に、よく彼女らの名前を思い出して。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「真里亞の魔導書に、彼女らの特徴がよく記されてるよ。…七杭の姉妹は、名前を間違えられることをとても嫌う。召喚する前に、よく彼女らの名前を思い出して」
Russian (RU): "Их характеристики подробно описываются в гримуаре Марии. ...Эти сёстры очень не любят, когда их имена путают. Поэтому хорошенько запомни их имена перед призывом."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Suas características estão todas descritas no grimório da Maria. ...As Sete Irmãs das Sete Estacas odeiam quando você erra os nomes delas. Grave bem seus nomes antes de invocá‐las."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「在真里亞的魔導書中，有詳細記著她們的特徵喲。…七樁姐妹非常討厭被人叫錯名字。在召喚前，先好好想起她們的名字來。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「在真里亚的魔导书中，有详细记着她们的特征哟。…七桩姐妹非常讨厌被人叫错名字。在召唤前，先好好想起她们的名字来。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Le loro caratteristiche erano descritte molto bene nel grimorio di Maria. {n}Le Sorelle dei Sette Pugnali si arrabbiano davvero tanto se sbagli i loro nomi. Ricorda bene i loro nomi prima di evocarle."

Steam (ST): A packed page told of the Seven Stakes of Purgatory. ...It described the Seven Sisters in great detail.
Umineko Project (UP): A colossal number of pages telling of the Seven Stakes of Purgatory.{n}...They described the seven sisters in great detail.
PC Japanese (JP): 煉獄の七杭のことを記した膨大なページ。…七人の姉妹のことを事細かに記述してある。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 煉獄の七杭のことを記した膨大なページ。{n}…七人の姉妹のことを事細かに記述してある。
Russian (RU): Плотно исписанная страница, рассказывающая о семи кинжалах чистилища.{n}...На ней в подробностях описывались семеро сестёр.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Havia um colossal número de páginas contando sobre as Sete Estacas do Purgatório....Elas descreviam as sete irmãs de forma extremamente detalhada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在記述著煉獄七樁的那部分紙頁中。{n}…詳盡記載著七位姐妹的事。

Steam (ST): ...Yes. I think I memorized almost this entire page once in the past.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Yes. Quite a long time ago, I think I learned these pages almost by heart.
PC Japanese (JP): ……そう。ずいぶん昔には、このページのことをほとんど丸暗記していたような気がする。
Russian (RU): ......Хорошо. Кажется, однажды в прошлом я запомнила всю страницу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Sim. Um bom tempo atrás, eu pensei ter aprendido sobre essas páginas quase que com o meu coração.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……對了。我好像曾在很久以前，幾乎把這些內容全都死記硬背了下來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……对了。我好像曾在很久以前，几乎把这些内容全都死记硬背了下来。

Steam (ST): The more I read it, the more I start to remember...
Umineko Project (UP): The more I read it, the more I start to remember...

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quanto mais eu lia, mais eu começava a lembrar...

Chinese Simplified (CN): 越是读下去，就越是逐渐想起来了…。

Steam (ST): By the pictures and characteristics written on the grimoire, I could tell that the stake in my hand was "Mammon's stake".
Umineko Project (UP): By the illustrations and identifying characteristics written in the grimoire, I could tell that the stake in my hand was the "Stake of Mammon".

Russian (RU): Исходя из картинок и характеристик, предоставленных гримуаром, я смогла выяснить, что кинжалом в моей руке был "Кинжал Мамоны".
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Pelas ilustrações e identificando as características escritas no grimório, eu pude afirmar que a estaca em minha mão era a "Estaca de Mammon".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從魔導書上的插圖與寫下的特徵上看，在我手邊的那根樁，乃是「馬蒙之樁」。

Steam (ST): In the past, I hadn't had any stakes, so I'd summoned them without any vessel.
Umineko Project (UP): In the past, I had been summoning them without any vessel, because I never had any stakes.

Russian (RU): В прошлом, не имея при себе ни одного из кинжалов, я призывала их без всякого сосуда.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No passado, eu as invoquei sem um receptáculo porque nunca tive suas estacas.

Steam (ST): ...So, this was the first time I'd clearly seen any of the Seven Stakes, let alone Mammon.
Umineko Project (UP): ......So this was the first time I had gotten a good look at any of the seven stakes, not just Mammon.

Russian (RU): ......Поэтому то был первый раз, когда я смогла чётко рассмотреть кого‐либо из семи кинжалов, не говоря уже о Мамоне.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Então essa foi a primeira vez que eu pude olhar bem para as sete estacas, não apenas para Mammon.

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……所以，不仅限于马蒙，这是我头一次仔细看七桩。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "Mammon. The fifth sister. Controls the deadly sin of greed. ...An incredible kid."
Umineko Project (UP): "Mammon. The fifth sister. Presides over the deadly sin of greed. ......What an incredible kid."
PC Japanese (JP): 「マモン。５女。七つの大罪の強欲を司る。……凄い子よね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「マモン。５女。七つの大罪の強欲を司る。……凄い子よね」
Russian (RU): "Мамона. Пятая сестра. Заведует смертным грехом жадностью. ......Невероятная личность."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Mammon. A quinta irmã. Preside sobre o pecado capital da ganância. ......É uma criança incrível."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「馬蒙。五女。掌管七宗大罪中的貪婪。……好厲害呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「马蒙。五女。掌管七宗大罪中的贪婪。……好厉害呢。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Steam (ST): "Greed also controls aspirations, the desire to improve oneself, and the strength to live. It definitely doesn't mean only bad things. ...She's rude, but she's a girl who tries really hard."
Umineko Project (UP): "Greed also controls aspirations, the desire to improve oneself, and the strength to live. It definitely doesn't mean only bad things. ......She's rude, but she's a girl who tries really hard."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「強欲は、向上心、上昇志向、生きる強さなども司る。決して悪い意味だけではないんだよ。……口は悪いけど、とてもがんばり屋さんな子だし」
Russian (RU): "Жадности также подвластны стремления, желание самосовершенствования и сила к жизни. Она не обязательно означает что‐то плохое. ......Она по натуре грубоватая, но очень старательная девушка."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "A ganância também controla as aspirações, os desejos de melhor a si mesmo e a força para viver. Não significa apenas coisas ruins. ......Ela pode ser rude, mas é uma boa garota que sempre busca dar o seu melhor."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "...I see. You could say that without desire, there's no reason to live."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Yes. You could say that without desire, there's no reason to live."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……そうね。欲がないってことはつまり、生きてる理由がないってことだし」

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……是呢。毕竟，所谓无欲，即是没有活着的理由。」

Umineko Project (UP): For a while, I heightened my concentration and digested the information that was written about Mammon.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 我提高集中力，仔细读取了好一会儿关于马蒙的情报。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Per un po', alzai la mia concentrazione e assimilai le informazioni che erano scritte riguardo Mammon.

Steam (ST): ...The more the summoner knows about the target that's being summoned, the better... Knowledge is connected to magical power.
Umineko Project (UP): ......The more the summoner knows about the target that's being summoned, the better... Knowledge brings about magical power.
PC Japanese (JP): ……召喚者は、呼び出す対象について詳しく知れば知るほどに良い…。知識は魔力に結びつく。
Russian (RU): ......Чем больше призыватель знает о том, кого призывает, тем лучше...Знание связано с магической силой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Quanto mais o invocador sabe sobre seu alvo que pretende invocar, melhor é... O conhecimento está relacionado ao poder mágico.

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……召唤者越熟悉召唤对象的事越好…。知识会与魔力相连结。

Umineko Project (UP): ......I began to fill my head with knowledge about Mammon, and build the necessary amount of magic power for the summoning.

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……将关于马蒙的知识装满头脑，提高召唤所必需的魔力。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "...Grimoires can be a bit interesting. This might be a much better read than some lame novel. ...It really takes me back."
Umineko Project (UP): "......Grimoires are a little bit interesting, aren't they. Maybe much more interesting than reading some crappy novel. ......And it really takes me back, somehow."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……魔導書って、ちょっとだけ面白いわね。下手くそな小説を読むより、よっぽど面白いかもしれない。……何だか懐かしい気持ちになるわ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……魔導書って、ちょっとだけ面白いわね。下手くそな小説を読むより、よっぽど面白いかもしれない。……何だか懐かしい気持ちになるわ」
Russian (RU): "......Гримуары являются несколько интересным чтивом. Он даже может быть гораздо интересней чтения какого‐нибудь второсортного романа. ......Это навевает воспоминания."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Grimórios são bem interessantes, não são? Talvez muito melhor que ler um livro ruim. ......E, de alguma forma, isso me deixou um pouco nostálgica."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……魔导书，有点儿意思呢。比起读蹩脚的小说，还是读这个要有趣得多也说不定。……不由得涌起了些怀念的感觉呢。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... I grimori sono un po' interessanti. Potrebbe essere più interessante che leggere qualche stupido libro. ... E mi porta davvero indietro."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Steam (ST): "For a grimoire, it is demanded not only that you understand the letters, but that you fill up the world of the space between the lines, giving birth to a world from the pictures and creating things in various ways.
Umineko Project (UP): "For a grimoire, it is demanded not only that you understand the text, but that you expand the world from the gaps between the lines, and give birth to a world from the illustrations, creating things in various ways."
PC Japanese (JP): 「魔導書は、ただ文字を読み取るだけじゃなく、行間から世界を膨らませたり、挿絵から世界を生み出したりと、様々な創造を要求されるの。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「魔導書は、ただ文字を読み取るだけじゃなく、行間から世界を膨らませたり、挿絵から世界を生み出したりと、様々な創造を要求されるの」
Russian (RU): "При чтении гримуара от читателя требуется не только понимать написанное, но и заполнять пространство между строк, порождая мир с картинок и создавая вещи разнообразными способами."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Para um grimório, é necessário mais do que apenas entender o que está escrito, mas que você expanda o mundo a partir dos intervalos entre as linhas, e dê vida a um mundo a partir das ilustrações, criando coisas de diversas formas."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「看魔導書不僅僅是在讀取文字。從字裡行間膨脹起世界呀，從插圖中誕生出世界呀，看的人還會被要求作出各種各樣的創造。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「看魔导书不仅仅是在读取文字。从字里行间膨胀起世界呀，从插图中诞生出世界呀，看的人还会被要求作出各种各样的创造。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Per un grimorio, è richiesto non solo che tu capisca le lettere, ma che tu riempia il mondo dello spazio tra le righe, e dare vita a un mondo dalle immagini, creando cose in svariate maniere.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Steam (ST): ...The power to give birth to something. For someone who has that, such as you, a grimoire should be more interesting than any book. ...I've always known that you'd be able to understand that."
Umineko Project (UP): "......The power to create. For someone who has that, such as you, a grimoire should be more interesting than any book. ...I've always known that you'd be able to understand that."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……生み出す力。これを持つ縁寿になら、どんな本よりも魔導書は面白いはずだよ。…縁寿になら理解できるって、真里亞はずっと知ってたもの」
Russian (RU): "......Могущество порождать что‐либо. Для обладающего им, вроде тебя, чтение гримуара будет гораздо интересней любой книги. ...Мария всегда знала, что ты способна это понять."

Steam (ST): "......That should be...enough knowledge of Mammon for now. ......Yes. I've remembered it, more or less. ...I'll give it a try."
